They're always watching.  <Breakfist points up.>  Vulca told me to follow that big beam of Light in the sky.  Goes to a tower guarded by a big old brute, though. Couldn't get in.

Breaking a Few Eggs : As you can see, we have a gorm problem.I'm not sure what has them so riled up. They've been getting bigger, more hostile. It must be due to the anima drought. If nothing stops them, they'll eat everything!Their egg production is out of control. We can't let their population grow any larger. Please, go in to their nests and destroy as many of their eggs as you can find.

The Last Guy : You're not the first newcomer wanting to become famous. There've been a lot like you around!   The last few wanted to prove themselves by killing a giant bloodtusk... none of them ever returned! You want to get recognition?  Go find all those missing newcomers and kill the bloodtusk yourself.

The Maw : $p, your arrival has set Maldraxxus ablaze. If you have any honor, you will do as I ask.  I believe I know where our answers may lie. The baron preceding Draka was lost to the Maw. It is said you have entered that dark abyss... and returned.  If the baron survived, he may know our next course of action.  You came here from Oribos. Return there, and see if you can find a way back to the Maw.

The First New Growth : Long have we lain dormant. With souls, with anima, we grow once more.   A choice now awaits. How shall we grow? You may decide which flower blooms first.  In time, with more anima and willing souls, the whole garden will prosper. For now, a single blossom signals hope for the future.  Lady Moonberry will want to know of your choice. Seek her out once it is made.

Who Shapes the Forest : You have fulfilled your calling, Maw Walker, and brought calm to our forest.  Stay vigilant, for others will similarly call upon you in time.  The anima you have recovered will be of great use to the Heart of the Forest. Bring it to Zayhad. They will ensure it is safe until it is needed. You will find them deep in the roots of the Heart of the Forest.

Medallion of Avarice : The Medallion of Avarice was the tool of the Curator.  With its power it granted her authority over the Catacombs Ward. Combined with her knowledge of the vast library of sinstones Revendreth has accumulated over the ages, the Curator was a master of her craft.  When Denathrius defeated my first rebellion, he tossed both myself and the Curator into the Maw.   The Curator was clever, though, and she hid the medallion before Denathrius could act. Come, let us speak of plans.

Archival Protection : The rarest volumes are kept at the top of this tower, protected by an entity called the Archivist.  This stoic guardian is incorruptible. Intractable. Completely uninterested in striking a fair bargain!  Its utter lack of business acumen is really quite upsetting.  Ah, well. I fear we have no choice but to dispatch this impediment. Shall we?

Necrolord Assault : The Jailer's forces  have been caught off guard by our attack. We shall overrun Perdition Hold and defeat his champions at the Altar of Domination!  Your help is needed Maw Walker. Assist our forces on the battlefield!
Sundered Souls : The traps... they didn't affect us before. Too many souls... escaping.   They... made new traps... tear apart fleeing souls...  ...too late for me. Destroy... so others might escape!

Weapon of Mass Construction : We are in luck!  Surgeon Stitchflesh and his assistant have not returned from Bastion.  The entire Stitchyard is lightly guarded.  We must work fast. See if you can get the equipment operational. Once it is active, we can begin the construction process.

The Blade of the Primus : That's everything I need. Time to get to work.  I'd stay close, if I were you. Forging a weapon is never a simple task when the Primus's handiwork is involved.  If he taught me anything, it was to expect the unexpected.
Back to The Heart : We should hurry back to Ardenweald!  You go on ahead and find Ysera. I'll escort the Stonewright there and make sure Huln gets back.

Signs of the Lion : Thanks to your efforts, Thrall, Jaina Proudmoore, and Baine Bloodhoof are safe. Yet so long as the Jailer holds any hero of Azeroth, I fear he has power over us all.  It seems Anduin has been taken deeper into the tower than the others. Before I risk peering inside, you must make one last attempt to find him.  You say the Jailer spoke of honing a weapon. I fear we are running out of time.  Do not relent, <name>. Search the twisting corridors of Torghast for any sign of the Young Lion.
Dismantling the Opposition : The Forsworn mobilize!  We cannot allow them to march.  Attune to Bron, share your power with him.  Between the three of us, we shall destroy this new centurion army!

Parting Ways : Me don't know what fate be comin' for ol' Vol'jin... but it be waitin' for me in Ardenweald.  Ashamane, Hir'eek, Shadra... dey belong dere, too.  We best be gettin' outta here. Me had enough of da Maw for an eternity.
The Power of the Maw : Lysonia flees to the Maw to enact her dark rituals. As the Maw Walker, you are the only one who can pursue her.  Take Kleia and my blade. She must be stopped.

Unsafe Workplace : You've returned just in time! Fae are in danger!It seems our actions have enraged the gorm. They are even more aggressive than they were before!While some fae were able to evacuate, there are still many who are trapped down there.Take this jar and slather anyone you find with a generous helping. That should heal their wounds and give them a chance to escape.

The Hunt Watches : The Wild Hunt protects. Many eyes watch for danger. Many ears listen for secrets.  Watcher Vesperbloom directs the eyes and ears of the forest.  Seek out our new growth, then turn to her for guidance.

A Hate-Hate Relationship : When the first of my sisters went missing, we were concerned. Those sent to find her did not return. Nor did the next.  What we have discovered is a dreadful betrayal by someone we once trusted.  Come, we must tell Odyn what we have witnessed in the Maw.  His wrath will be great.

Sanctum Upgrade: Mirror Network : Right. So, we got a Scroll of Dark Empowerment ready for youz that should manifest 'em mirror frames for you. Pre'y standard work.  Thing is, after you going to need a proper mirror maker to get 'em up an' workin'.   Prince Renathal might know a fang with the right skills. Best speak with him.
Disrupting the Chain : From the desk of the Tithelord:  All supply carriages must re-route to Stonevigil for collection assistance. Once complete, you may resume your regularly scheduled routes.

The Pupil Returns : Now that you have your disguise--and I have assurance of your loyalty--it is time you reported to your new master.  Find Kel'Thuzad within the Vault of Souls. Do whatever tasks he requires of you, but keep your eyes open for anything untoward.  My oculus will continue to accompany you so that I can provide guidance when the time is right.  We will uncover this new baron's true intentions.

Survivors of Heartwood Grove : Korenth... I can't believe he's...  We have to save whomever we can. Droman Krelnor is too strong for us to face alone.  I saw a few other survivors scattered around the grove. Hurry, we have no time to waste!

Idle Hands : If you want my help then you are going to need to help me first.There is a group of spriggans that have assaulted the growthworks to the northeast. They are causing all manner of havoc and I simply will not abide this trespass into my lands.Go there and teach them a lesson. If they will not flee, then slay them on the spot!

Rallying Maldraxxus : We need all the help we can get! It's taking all we have to hold our ground against the other houses, let alone gain any ground against them.  Truth be told, your blade will be welcome anywhere. There are no shortage of battles to be won, foes to be toppled, or weary soldiers to be relieved.  Help us regain control of Maldraxxus, and in the name of the Primus I will see you are amply rewarded.

Hyphae Patrol: Gossamer Cliffs : Bad news from the Gossamer Cliffs. We need to help.The varmints terrorizing the poor silk striders have become more cruel and aggressive lately. The silk striders are important to Ardenweald; more important than almost anyone else knows. We can't lose any more.Let me know when you're ready to go and we'll scare those gits away for good!

The Heart of the Forest : I knew we were gonna get along! Welcome to our covenant. Well, almost.  There's just a few details left. Little things. You know. Oaths to be made, blood pacts to sort out, firstborns to be promised.  <Moonberry snorts a laugh.>  I'm just kidding!  Well, not about the oaths part. We take those seriously around here.  I'll meet you at the camp outside the Heart of the Forest!

Celestial Shadowlands Chart : <You recognize this relic from the Archivists' Codex.  The mawsworn discarded it, believing it to be useless.  And the chart is useless, without the accompanying data to plot the relative locations of Shadowlands afterlives. If the research were retrieved from deceased scholars, the chart could be returned to the Archivist, fully functional.>

Shadow's Fall : Despite our efforts, the Void stands strong. All of the forces of Bastion fight, and fall one by one...  The Void cannot destroy us!  They are led by Tezulat the Annihilator, scourge of a thousand realms. This day, his reign of terror will end!

The Night Market : <Dracho motions to keep your voice down.>  I need some assistance, I promise you will be paid handsomely.   At the edge of The Banewood lies some ruins. These ruins are home to a marketplace run by some brokers. They won't let me back there. Let's just say that my goods were deemed to not be up to their authenticity metrics.   But you... you're a Maw Walker! Bring them this package and exchange it for some Surberries from Ardenweald.   Just don't say I sent you.

Things They Leave Behind : Chordy bored. Chordy want to go on adventure! You want to go too, yes?  Pale people in tall buildings have many shinies and luckydos. We go there and find some for ourselves!  You ready to go?

Stonevigil Unrest : Greetings, <name>. I'm sure you've met my associate, Baroness Draka.  I have recruited her to help us with the growing threat of the Tithelord.  His involvement with the Maldraxxi renegades is troubling.  One conspiracy begets another. So I recruited Draka to help us end it.  We must not treat this situation lightly. We first need to put an end to his oppression of Stonevigil Overlook. That way we can we win over the hearts and minds of his subjects.

A Suitable Demise : Surviving in this miserable place has been difficult, but I must confess... sending a few Mawsworn to a suitable demise does bring me joy.  The soulforgers in Zovaal's Cauldron are among the cruelest minions the Jailer employs. I find satisfaction in disposing of their cores in the very forges which they maintain.  This of course has the added benefit of temporarily slowing down their arms production, if you require more sober justification for your actions.

Her Rightful Place : Mor'Bitan has met his end... and a painful one at that.  Your fortitude contributed in no small part to my success. You have earned my allegiance... for the time being.   There is much left to do, should you truly desire ownership of this realm.  Let us regroup at the Seat.

A Touch of Humility : With the Temple of Humility under our control, its power shall flow back into the Crest of Ascension once more.  Join me below so that we may witness it together. Mikanikos has ensured it will become even more magnificent as its power grows.

Keys to the Ruin : At last, our target is within reach.  The necropolis rests above us, moored to this platform by a necrotic restraining bolt.  Twigin can fly you to the apex of the necropolis. It will be ours to command once you insert this keystone.  We will prepare for our departure. Rejoin us when you are done.  Victory will soon be ours.

Fangcrack's Fan Club : Fangcrack is the strongest dredger I e'er seen! He's incredible!  He's down there, reaching into dat big Torghast portal, pulling the baddies right out o' their home!  They don't even know what's happenin' half the time, ha ha!  Me and Cudgelface joined his fan club soon as we got here.  You want in? You gotta earn your membership same as everyone else: go down there and fight whatever he pulls out of the portal!

If Even One is Worthy : I have seen firsthand that worthy souls have been unjustly cast into Maw.  Gresit here was almost cast in himself by the Lord Chamberlain's minion. He has more than proven himself under my care.  Look among the souls that the Jailer's filth have deemed "unworthy". Inspect each to confirm that they deserve their fate.  Even if we examine every soul in the Tremaculum and find only a single worthy one to bring back to Revendreth, it will still be valuable.

A Conduit for Growth : While our bond is powerful in and of itself, you can also enhance it through the use of conduits.  Conduits channel the anima between soulbinds in many different ways, increasing both of our potential in the process. They allow us to attune ourselves to each other's unique strengths.  Let's use a few now. If they can further empower our bond, then they can aid us in protecting the forest.

From a Dark Place : You rescued some of the night elves from the Maw before. While the danger is still great, I must ask you to do it again.  I have to believe that we can save them. As many of them as possible.  Please, go and see if you can recover any more lost souls.

We Strike Now : The time has come. The Wild Hunt has driven the Drust back to their stronghold at the edge of Ardenweald.  Their scouts report that Gorak Zhar herself is among them. This may be our only opportunity to fully purge the minions of Thros from this realm.  Lord Herne awaits your arrival at the battlefront. Go with haste, <name>.

The End and the Beginning : I am so happy you restored our connection to the Queen's Conservatory!  In light of this accomplishment, the Winter Queen has requested you attend her at the Grove of Awakening!   You will see first hand the purpose of Ardenweald and gain a greater understanding of our sacred charge before you too, take it upon yourself.  Hurry! Don't keep everyone waiting!

Their New Home : It pains me to leave my mother behind... but the souls of my people must be brought to safety.  I heard the attendants in Oribos speaking of a place called Ardenweald. A realm of ancient forests where the spirits of nature slumber.  This is a land you know well, is it not? I would see its wonders with my own eyes.  Perhaps the spirits there will know how to save my minn'do from the Night Warrior's power.

Magical Mystery Tour! : <Lady Moonberry's voice rises from the scroll.>  <name>! It seems Huln got into some trouble. And--well--it's complicated. We could really use your help in Revendreth! Please meet me at Dominance Keep.  See you soon!

The Proper Souls : We must save as many souls as we can from the fate we have just witnessed.  Search the halls for souls who have escaped the Lord Chamberlain's perverse rituals. Subjugate them and bring them to me inside the Halls of Atonement.  Together, we will make certain that each soul is appropriately processed and cared for.

I Could Be A Contender : Hold up there, <brother/sister>.   If you are serious about fighting in the Arena you're going to need a manager.  Lucky for you, <brother/sister>, I know a guy. He's just had some openings in his roster of fighters and you look like just the type of <class> he needs to fill his ranks.  Name is Louison, you can find him at the gate just east of here.  Tell him I sent ya, <brother/sister>.

And Then There Were None : Ilka and Samu argued, you say? And you found a coded message indicating that the tithe was going to be sent out soon. Those are helpful clues that will allow me to put the puzzle together.   It's clear to me now who betrayed the village and what we need to do about it! You deliver invitations to a meeting to our suspects and I'll prepare to reveal the traitor.

Lost Vaults : I have finished my research on more relics that may still exist in Korthia. I believe they are still within our smaller vaults.  With your help, I can recreate devices that are capable of repairing the entrances to these vaults.  Take note of the echoes of relics that are still missing. Please review them so you know what to look for.

Sanguine Depths: An Ally Within : There are whispers of a prisoner within these depths that may be of use to our cause.   Whether this information can be relied upon is unknown. It is just as likely to be a trap, but still, we must investigate.  We cannot afford to ignore an opportunity such as this.   Venture into the Sanguine Depths and recover this valuable prisoner.

Whisper of Hope : Akarek's demise has cast a dark shadow upon our house... but it is in the shadows where we thrive.  I know that not all the Eyes have perished. They could lie in wait, hidden for eternity, if such was demanded of them.  But it is time to reclaim our destiny. Take my sigil through the wreckage and awaken any Eyes who remain.  We will seize our victory.

A Valuable Find: De Other Side : Mueh'zala has been around for many generations, how many exactly we cannot say. His domain is a land of mystery to us all.   But we are a people of probabilities and margins. A creature of that age, with such power, and the many ancient souls within his domain, has a great chance to be in possession of a relic of unfathomable rarity.  <The light around Ta'lan's head flares brightly for a moment. He seems... excited?>  Slay the foolish creature, bring me his secrets, I will reward you handsomely!

Dredger Duty : You fixed up the muck pool so we can make some dredgers, but them devourers are gonna keep causin' trouble.  We're gonna need a Gem of Binding so we can dredge up a biggun to protect the pool.  I'll show you how to dredge up some disposable dredgers to work with for now.  Get 'em digging in the rubble to find us a Gem of Binding, and then we'll reshape 'em all into a biggun to kick them devourers outta here!

Ember Court: Lost Chalice Band : Hips was smart to send you my way. The Lost Chalice Band plays the best music this side of the Maw!  The band is not quite ready to tour yet, however.  The musicians are all safe in the crypt behind me, but their instruments have been confiscated by our obnoxious neighborhood authorities!  Noise complaints and all that.  Help me get those back, and perhaps recruit a few groupies and roadies along the way to help out, and we shall throw the best concert your court has ever seen!

Call In a Favor : We will do just as my baroness commands. Let us conjure a helmsman before us... however displeased it might make her.  Activate the beacon and prepare yourself for a fight. The liches regard all Eyes as their enemies, and I am certain your reputation among them does you no favors.

Garden in Turmoil : Please excuse me for not standing. I would rather not disturb these creatures.  If you have a desire to help the creatures of Bastion, Zosime needs aid to regain control of our garden. You will find her just down this path.  Go in service.

Through the Fire and Flames : Margrave Krexus was pleased to hear of your service to our house. He senses great potential within you.  Potential that must be tested.  A stone stands at the center of our citadel, surrounded by magma. Reaching the stone is a challenge of endurance and fortitude.  This trial is usually attempted only by our most renowned soldiers, but Margrave Krexus commands you to attempt the rite at once.  Go on, then. Prove your worth.

A Mycelial Network : Anima flows into the deepest of roots, feeding the mushrooms. Long has it been since we used the rings to travel across Ardenweald.  Restore our connection to the mushroom network.

The Right Stuff : Building something that can help in your mission will require some metal.  The constructs of the Forsworn have metal parts, suitable for what we need. Tainted by the Forsworn, they will need some additional work.  Collect their metal and smelt them in the flames of the Eternal Forge to purge the corruption.

Sins of the Past : The Countess built her reputation on being a native venthyr, never a soul.  Revealing her sinstone to the world would be catastrophic. This is the leverage we need for the information we seek.  She will tell us where Alwin is. Where the seal is.  This mirror leads to her estate. I will follow behind you as backup, but the kyrian shall wait here.  Don't let her threaten you. You hold the power.

Setting the Ground Rules : Back to rescue more souls? How intrepid.  Though I must say, your earlier escapade has drawn the Jailer's attention... and his ire. After all, none have successfully eluded him before.   Except for me.  Now his forces are on high alert, hunting down any errant souls that the fabled Maw Walker may try to steal from him.  It has made things quite... inconvenient for me. If you and I are going to work together, we need to set a few ground rules.  And you must be properly equipped.

The Princeguard : Renathal carries himself well, but hides great pain. His wounds from Denathrius have not healed.  He is vulnerable.  He intends to send you to secure his old fortress of Darkwall Tower with banners and rely on his own strength to deter enemies. This is a poor tactical choice.  Take this small reserve of anima with you and revive Chelra the Bladewall. She was last seen at Darkwall. Revive her and she can aid you in taking the tower.
We Can Rebuild Him : Gatamatos needs numerous repairs to meet functional standards.  Upkeeping phalynx is part of the role. Lend a hand so we may finish the repairs thoroughly and quickly.

Aerial Advantage : Gharmal's rocs dominate the skies above, striking at our forces as we advance. We cannot move the necropolis into position until they are cleared out!  I would slaughter them myself, but the cowards remain out of reach, and I am not constructed for flight.  You, however, seem slight enough of build. Take my riding hook and latch onto a roc.   Once you are atop of one, beat it to a pulp. Worry about the landing later.

Loose Threads : We're missing a few tools and parts for sewing a construct. We need these items if we're to rebuild my construct!  Search the surrounding area. See if you can find us what we need.  Search tables for the Skewering Needles, you can find haulers that carry Razorthread Spools, and look for Clotting Patches on constructs you kill.

Kivarr the Thornspeaker : In my youth, I was mentored by a wise and powerful Thornspeaker named Kivarr. She passed from this world long ago, but her soul may yet rest within the Shadowlands.  Kivarr's knowledge is ancient and vast, far eclipsing my own. She may be able to offer you the guidance that I cannot.  Seek her out. Deliver the fetish to her. She will know what to do.  May the wind be your guide.

Back into the Darkness : Souls continue to pour into the Maw, and with them the anima that could help us.  You were able to rescue me from that place. Can I count on your strength to repeat the same trick? Please, get us more willing souls so we can bolster this sanctum's power.  Seek out what aid you can and do what we can't, Maw Walker. You are our last, best, hope.

You Cannot Hide : There are those who held their affiliation with Kel'Thuzad secret even after he made his move. They too were involved in the fall of my Margrave, and they too shall die.  I have one name, Drava'ora, but there are more. Sin'dane had indicated these traitors carry marks of favor. She doesn't know who has them so we'll start killing until we find them.  The rest will see the example made.

Path of Ascension: Mad Mortimer : Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.  Their sights this week are set on Mad Mortimer, that they may learn from the lessons his memory teaches.  When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Mad Mortimer to prove their growth.

A Calling in Revendreth : We got a lot of problems out there, boss. Big ones, little ones, really smelly ones, it's a lot.  If we're gonna take on Denathrius, the first thing we gotta do is clean up right here in Revendreth.  We get things cleaned up, yeah? Then we get some new allies, and we probably get our hands on some anima to boot.  It's a call to action, it is. And it's important that we get started right away.  Get on out there and get your boots muddy!

Feathers of Flight : Now, let us see this next to my arm...  Look! There many long feathers along the edges of the Larion's wing!  And none on mine. This is why I can not fly!  Hmm. It will take lots of flight feathers to give me wings.   You help?
RSVP: Choofa : Oooh a party! I love parties.  My friends have to come too or it's just not as much fun. Ask them please! You need to find Awool, Rury, and Slanknen so we can go together.

Pie Not? : I want to cook something warm, savory, and gooey!  That's right! I want to make a lovely bone marrow pie! When it's done, you'll be as full as a tick. I guarantee it!   Now, just any old marrow won't do. I need the very best and rarest marrow.  And that's where you come in! I need you to help Mama out and dig that marrow up. Yes... dig.   Oh and be ready to knock some heads. Maldraxxus doesn't take kindly to being carved up.

Random Memory Access : When the Jailer snared Korthia and dragged it toward the Maw, he destroyed so much in this place. Not only mountains and buildings, but the people, too.  Those people had lives, hopes, memories.  I have to think that they can't all be gone, and we might be able to save something of them that lingers.  Here, take some of my power. See if you can collect those memories. Bring them to me, and I'll keep them safe.   No one should be forgotten.

Above My Station : While I indeed know the location of the Veiled Market, I fear I can do little in terms of providing you with transportation to it.  In return for your assistance with a task, I can send you to someone who can assist us both. There is a bounty hunter at Transfer Station Ta, a broker enclave in Bastion. He is better suited to help you... and he owes me a shipment.  Meet with Ta'oku and tell him that Ta'nla sent you.  For your convenience, I can offer use of a portal. After all, we are partners, yes?

Shades of Muck : Yeah, this here muck pool's got everythin' we need to make your dredger butler.  We'll make this one special just for you. Made to specifications, as the fangs say.  First up, you gotta choose its color. Us dredgers comes in all kind of different shades of muck.  Take a peek at some me fellow dredgers and let me know what color we should dredge up for your butler.  We can recolor a dredger after-the-fact, but it ain't pleasant.  <Rendle shudders at the though.>

The Ember Court : We've got everything we need to host our first real Ember Court whenever you're ready, Maw Walker.  Take a moment to finalize everything, and then we'll open court!  Remember, we're trying to impress Cryptkeeper Kassir and convince him that we know what we're doing, so make sure you choose the refreshments and entertainment we hired for him!  Once everything's ready, let me know and I'll open the court!
Clearing the Walls : <This scroll shows the locations of a series of pylons, that protect Perdition Hold from assault.  Destroying these Pylons could aid in the success of our attack>

The Fate of Ara'lon : <name>, I have an urgent request to make of you.  Recently, the Wild Hunt has been encountering the masked fae in greater numbers... particularly in the area surrounding Blackthorn Grove. I sent a hunting party to investigate, but they have yet to return.  Ara'lon was leading the hunt. You have offered him aid before, yes? I ask that you do so again.  Search the area for signs of the missing hunters and report back to me.

It Used to Be Quiet Here : Well... You don't look like the rest of 'em, do you?  <Chiselgrump shrugs.>  Doesn't bother me. Keep my head down and do my job, making sure these sinstones stay in good shape.  Keep breaking my tools, though.  Bring me some more chisels and I'll teach you an old dredger construction trick.

Disturbing the Peace : This anima drought isn't hard on just the kyrian. The wildlife of Bastion are suffering too!  Many creatures are becoming aggressive and menacing, wyrms and cloudfeathers especially. They are hurting the other wildlife and long beyond saving.  If someone doesn't clear this garden of these starved creatures, we can no longer meditate here. And if we can no longer meditate, that will make the anima shortage even worse!

Anima-Laden Dreamcatcher : You stumble upon an enchanted dreamcatcher, placed so remotely that it has managed to collect a significant amount of anima without being harvested. Droman Dawnblossom in nearby Dreamsong Fenn would surely appreciate its safe return.
Precious Roots : Korthia. A sister forest, stricken.  But in the throes of destruction, there is still hope.   Gather the anima, and build anew.
Korthia Awaits : Ready yourself, <name>. Our allies await your arrival in Korthia.

Just Wing It : For untold ages, the humble Ardenmoth has supplied the scales for the creation of armor for the Wild Hunt.   Now, with our attention divided between the threats to the realm and the anima drought, it has become increasingly difficult for our foragers to find the perfect scales that we require.  Only the scales of the highest quality are suitable. If you should obtain any in your travels and return with them, I shall ensure you are well rewarded.

Mysterious Rifts : Thank you so much for your aid, <name>. I have uncovered more relics from the codex that remain intact.  The key to finding these relics rests within the strange rifts within Korthia.  I can now craft a way for you to enter these rifts, in order to gain access to these missing relics.  As before, take note of the echoes to understand what these relics look like. Please be sure to examine them before you depart.

Voices of the Eternal : <Bolvar peers at the grand figures before him, at the numberless gateways stretching out into the ether.>  This chamber is... truly wondrous.  Yet there is no time to be awestruck. The Honored Voice must begin this meeting at once.

Gathering The Hunt : Loath as I am to aid Bwonsamdi, Mueh'zala must be made to answer for his crimes.  We will eradicate his worshippers and drive them from the forest before they cause more harm.  Rally the groves and muster the Wild Hunt. Ardenweald has need of its protectors.  Make haste, <huntsman/huntress>.

Journey to Ardenweald : The warning you received from the Primus needs to reach the Winter Queen of Ardenweald, <name>. The Eternal Ones must stand together against the coming darkness.  The Winter Queen oversees the cycle between Death and Life. In her forest slumber ancient spirits of nature that must be reborn.  I fear the anima drought will have taken an especially grim toll upon her realm.   The night fae can lead you to the Queen. Bring her this message, and she will know what needs to be done.

The Problem with Containing a Death Loa : Me know Mueh'zala still be hidin' someting. Ol' Bwonsamdi gonna find out what dat be.  But dis old loa's presence be drawin' all da undead in Nazmir ta me doorstep!  Me be needin' some time ta get Mueh'zala talkin'.   Dere be a troll, Zel'han, leadin' da undead. Kill him and show Mueh'zala him broken armor.  Dat should end any hope he be havin' of escapin'.

Ossein Enchantment : A potent blade requires potent components. I know of something that would suit our needs.  Recently a monstrosity trained by the constructs was snared by our soldiers at the eastern side of our stronghold. Vyraz insists we can siphon "intelligence" from the beast's mind.  Hmph. The will of the Primus trumps the desires of an ambitious baron!  The bones of that beast would forge the perfect hilt for this blade. I say you lay claim to them.

Consulting the Experts : We can restore the functions of the Lodestaff, but it will require the wisdom of the Archivists.  Not just me, but the Archivists who have come before. They were laid to rest near here. Given the scale of the destruction of Korthia and the likely possibility that this destruction will continue, this may be our last chance to visit their memorials before they are irrevocably ruined.  Visit the Archivists' memorials. Take Roh-Suir with you, so that he may take note of their messages before they are lost.

Ember Court: Glimpse of the Wilds : It would be wonderful to show Revendreth the wild creatures of Ardenweald!  You can get some Radiant Groupers near the waterfalls. They're fast so you have to grab them as they swim by.   Here's a net to use to subdue the Territorial Waders. They should follow you once you've caught them.  Highland Runestags will let you ride them if you aren't aggressive. Bring a few here to me, please. Watch out for the bulls, they're not at all friendly.  We will get others to help too. This sounds like fun.

Watcher Emil : Watcher Emil is my trusted overseer of the catacombs. Before I was thrown into the Maw, half of the mirror was entrusted to him.  I had him stationed at the Catacombs of Regret. But I do not know where in the sprawl he is.  There is a guard station near the entrance to the catacombs. Start the search there. There is an officer who can help us, I--I can't remember who. That is, provided they survived this whole mess.  You must find Emil at once. We may not have much time.

Becoming the Hunt : <Reldorn grins at you.>  He knew you'd be back! The Horned Hunter went on ahead to prepare the hunting ground. He said you should join him as soon as you can.   Now that you have the materials for the trap, you just need to reach him...  It's dangerous territory to traverse, but I've been devising a glamour that should help you avoid the attention of the roaming beasts. Maybe if it's useful, you could put in a good word for...  Ahem. Anyway, we should focus on your quarry. Good hunting, friend.

Report to Draven : You have chosen well.  The Venthyr must return to their duty helping souls atone for their sins, saving them from an eternity in the Maw.  Denathrius's treachery must be righted. Speak with General Draven and begin your future with your covenant.

Enemy at the Door : The remaining houses of Maldraxxus have joined forces against us. Their armies besiege the Seat of the Primus, and our defenses cannot hold forever.  Our reserves have met the enemy in battle. I need you to break the siege.  Report to Heirmir and Marileth. They will give you the means to rain destruction on our foes.

The Sea of Souls : Some force here seeks to keep us from finding Tyrande.  The trail of bodies seems to go into this... stream of souls.   I suggest we split up. I will follow along the bank of the river. You enter its current and follow the trail.  Should you need me, I will be close at hand.  We will find Tyrande, no matter where this course leads.

A Thread Of Hope : The Court of Night is akin to a thirsty flower, it quickly draws up its nutrients. If well supplied it will bloom and if its supply is depleted, it withers.  Our roots are beginning to dry, we need more anima!  I've sent workers out to place silk lined catchers along the roads and paths that cross Ardenweald. These catchers will collect a tiny bit of anima, not much but enough for what we need.  Seek them out and return the Anima Infused Silk to us.

Welcome To Our House : Your ties to the other covenants had me doubting you would return. I see now that was foolish of me.  Outsider or not, you have stood bravely beside the armies of Maldraxxus. I am confident the Primus would have welcomed you into our ranks with pride.  One day, he might return as well. But we cannot afford to wait.   In the Primus's absence, I will name you a Necrolord of Maldraxxus.

Spoiling For A Fight : Your contribution of anima has aided our operation here greatly. Several of our more famous competitors have come here lured by the flow of new anima.  Would you like to test yourself versus the famous Sabriel? There could be much profit for everyone, if you were to defeat her.  I can add her to the schedule, she will appear soon if you defeat the other challengers.

Storm the Maw : We have been able to do little to stem the flood of souls into the maw, until now. You, Maw Walker, have the power to put a stop to this.  We know little about the Jailer's lands, save that he is powerful beyond imagining.  I ask something of you today that I would not place upon anyone else. You must travel to his lands, and do what you can to slow the growth of his forces.  We must buy more time.

Path of Ascension: Azaruux : Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.  Their sights this week are set on Azaruux, that they may learn from the lessons their memory teaches.  When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Azaruux to prove their growth.

In Agthia's Memory : Greetings, mortal!  Are you here to learn about the legacy of Agthia, Paragon of Courage?  I welcome you to walk the grounds of this ancient battleground to learn of the battle that occurred here, and the heroic Paragon who saved all of Bastion and the Shadowlands.

Let the Hunt Begin : One step remains until we may begin the Penitent Hunt.  You and the other hunters will first siphon a small amount of anima from the souls. It will come with ease. The soul's time in the Grove of Terror causes trace anima to release.  This anima helps us venthyr in tracking the prey's fear.  I also ask that you do us the honor of signaling the hunt.  <The Fearstalker hands you an anima stake and a hollowed dredbat fang.>  Use these to complete the task.

It's a Dirty Job : This muck pool is all out of order. The anima shortage has taken its toll here for sure.   You see, the pools require filth and fiber to grow dredgers effectively. The problem is every time I try to treat the pool, the dang devourers are on my back!  Now the untreated muck is starting to coagulate into these elementals! Can you go and toss some of the filthy rubble into the pool to restore it?

Where a Soul Belongs : This soul is no longer tethered to his world of Azeroth.  Kleia must perform her duty and bear him to Oribos to be judged by the Arbiter.  Take this vesper. When you are ready, it will call Ascended to ferry you back across the Veil to Oribos.  Go in service.

Redemption for the Redeemer : <Energies of death and innervation struggle to free themselves from the blade and consume you to your very core.>  <The bonds of warding placed on this blade by Prince Renathal will not hold for long. It should be taken to Sinfall where more permanent arrangements have been made for this prisoner.>

Opening to Oribos : The prophecies told us that one day this dormant waystone would be needed by a  Maw Walker. That it would prove crucial to the fate of the Shadowlands.  It seems that day has come.  Draw upon the anima within you to activate this waystone. It will then be usable by all those who aid your cause.  If, as you say, Tal-Inara has created an anchor in Oribos, then that anchor will bring you back to us.  Go, <name>. Inform your allies that the Maw awaits... and that Korthia needs their help.

Army of One : Mevix will lead the attack, but you will finish it. There are no reinforcements, no cavalry.  Only you and your runeblade.  Show me the might you wield, outsider. Lay siege to the House of Constructs and bring them to ruin!

On the Edge of a Revelation : Ah! Good. You answered the call.  As you can see, there are many aspirants who require our aid. Myself and the other disciples are hard pressed to deal with all of them. Some are in greater need than others.  Aspirants are most at risk when they are on the precipice of a revelation. It is a critical moment that we cannot allow to pass without intervention.  You must push them, one way or another.  Find the most vulnerable among your peers and do what you can to help them find the path forward.

Small Bites : The reviews are in, $p. Our menu is too Revendreth-centric!  All the best courts have exotic appetizers, small plates, and other specialties that guests can look forward to every time they come.  And for a court like ours, which boasts frequent guests from other realms, we simply must do better!  Do not worry, after tireless research, I have drafted a very particular list of ingredients for you to find me.  Bring them to me, and I will serve our guests eternity on a platter!

Pulling Hairs : The abominations are well organized and well supplied. We've not been able to gain any ground.  A little disorganization in their supplies and reinforcements might give us an edge.  I need you to work you way behind their lines and eliminate three abominations handling their supplies.

The Knowledge Keepers : Our vault was built to store countless secrets and artifacts. Even if we gain entrance, we can't be certain of what the Jailer is looking for.  Certain attendants are given the title of record keeper. They track items stored in the vault, and are known for their utmost discretion.  A number of keepers have been taken captive by the Mawsworn and are being tortured for information.  Save the record keepers, <name>. They can help us determine what the Banished One seeks.

Wrath of Odyn : The horn has been forged and the worthy have been selected.  Now, <name>, we have only to bind my chosen val'kyr to the horn and infuse them with my power that they may strike with my fury.  Come, bear witness.

Rule 6 Footnote: Don't Forget Anything : In the Maw, you must never forget to take everything with you.  Many things crawl within the Beastwarrens. The runes you brought back indicate that something of interest may have been left behind by the brokers who were taken there.  See if you can find it.

Enhancing the Hold : As thanks for your efforts in recovering the anima and souls we now have available, you may decide which of Elysian Hold's features we upgrade first.  Once active, it shall expand our capabilities to help not only Bastion, but all the Shadowlands.  Do not worry--as you continue to recover anima and willing souls we will activate them all in time. For now, a single upgrade must suffice.

Theater of Pain: Help Wanted : Oh, bother--the Lich champion has withdrawn from the contest.  Well, then... It appears we have an opening! Would anyone like to enter in her stead?  Perhaps to increase the odds for their house?  Anyone?  Oh, <name>! So kind of you to volunteer. No better way to get experience than to just jump right in unprepared!  Remember, we can't all be winners.

A Place To Call Home : You didn't end up on my list... so, I guess we're friends... for the moment.  Rathan took the soul you freed to Butchers Block near the Seat of the Primus.   Let us meet him there and plan our next step together.

Tough as Silk : We are the heart of silk production in Ardenweald, but we can't do our work!   Our grove has been completely taken over by spriggans and these strange shapeshifting... things.  The silkstriders who spin the silk are very delicate creatures. They need peace and calm, and a little music to keep them happy! But with all these monsters all over the place, they're super stressed out.  Please, can you get in there and eliminate these hooligans, and see if you can help get us up and running again?

Compassion in Devotion : Our first order of business is to rededicate the Temple of Loyalty.  Pelagos has volunteered to stay here and help prepare for the ceremony. I requested that Nikolon bring his companions to meet us at Steward's Rest, to aid us in convincing some of the Forsworn of our new path.  Meet us there when you are able.

Monster Hunting : Make ready, <class>. We hunt a worldeater.  They are the largest of devourers, massive beings who can drain anima from an entire region within a matter of moments.   With Ardenweald suffering from the drought, a worldeater's presence could prove disastrous.  Still, we must not rush into battle without first understanding our prey. Tread the Elder Stand with me. Even creatures such as these leave spoor.  Knowing our quarry will be what allows us to slay it.

A Burden Worth Bearing : Mevix may be here for blood, but what I want is to spare my fallen kin from a terrible fate.  Most of my fellow kyrian were either slain in combat or shortly after arriving here. If their corpses were bound for this pit, then perhaps we can recover them before they are thrown into it.  Take the stewards with you and gather the bodies of my brethren. I will not allow them to be made into monsters.

At Your Service : I suppose I should commend you. You certainly exceeded my expectations.  Rathan can be sentimental, but he is right. This place can be our new home, and here we can construct new bodies for the souls you freed.  Inform Baroness Draka that she has earned the allegiance of Princess Emeni and the constructs of Butchers Block! We stand ready for whenever she has need of our strength.

Words of the Primus : Even in his absence, the wisdom of the Primus rings true. This message must have been put here to await one who proved worthy of hearing it.  <Draka peers at you.>  You came to Maldraxxus to learn why Bastion was invaded. Now you know that there is treachery in our ranks. And that there are noble souls here who will set things right.  Tell your allies in Oribos all you have witnessed. See that the warning of the Primus reaches the Eternal Ones.  It would be an honor to fight by your side again, <name>.

Land of Light : The Ember Ward is filled with outcasts from Revendreth society, whether they rebelled, crossed a noble, or simply looked at Denathrius wrong.  It is a Light-scorched land that drives venthyr mad, unless they manage to stay within the shadows.  If Alwin is there, it may be too late.  Let us visit Theotar at the Sanctuary of the Mad. I'm sure he will be pleased to see you.

Inquisitor Stelia's Sinstone : You never truly escape your past, Maw Walker.  Every venthyr once entered Revendreth as a soul, burdened by the immoralities of their mortal lives.  Like all souls, they carved their true names and most shameful transgressions into sinstones.  Knowledge that intimate can be a potent weapon, if wielded properly.  Locate the sinstones of the inquisitors aiding the Accuser so that you may kill them. Start with Stelia.  After they're dead, bring me the Accuser's sinstone. I will deal with her myself.
Introductions are in Order : Now yous is all set with yer new dredger, go ahead call on them and officially introduce yerself.

Souls for Sinfall : Baine suffers within Torghast, but at least we know that he yet lives.  Rushing to his rescue would prove disastrous without a plan of attack. I will see to preparing one.  In the meantime, I suggest you bring the souls you rescued back to Sinfall.   Denathrius's machinations have left the venthyr poorly provisioned, and Prince Renathal will require all the souls he can muster.

The Vessels of Metal : You have the bearing of one familiar with the art of smithing. But perhaps you have more to learn.  Vessels that hold the power of the runes can be crafted by a hand such as yours. But this I cannot teach you.  Hmm, there is a way. I will entrust you with a memory of my recipes for the vessels. Take it to a master of your craft and they will show you the way.  What's that? Do not worry. It is merely an echo of my memory. What you restored to me remains intact.

Taking Inventory : Dark forces be at work, <class>.   Ardenweald be where loa go ta be reborn after dey die on Azeroth. But some of da loa who be sleepin' in Ardenweald have gone missin'!  Gotta be someone powerful behind it, takin' dem from right under da Winter Queen...  Ol' Bwonsamdi can't be havin' loa vanishin' from Ardenweald. Dat could be me someday! No, no... we gonna put a stop to dis!  Go back ta Ardenweald and search for da missin' loa.

Everliving Statuette : <Your familiarity with the Archivists' Codex makes it clear that this is one of the missing relics.  Archivist Roh-Suir has a spot for this statuette in the Reliquary of Remembrance.>

Path of Ascension: Alderyn and Myn'ir : Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.  Their sights this week are set on Alderyn and Myn'ir, that they may learn from the lessons their memories teach.  When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Alderyn and Myn'ir to prove their growth.

Securing the House : Your journey into the Maw was impressive, but it will take even more phenomenal feats to earn the loyalty of the Maldraxxi.  Increase your renown among our ranks, Maw Walker. The Maldraxxi are dedicated soldiers, but they will not follow just anyone into battle. Let your deeds prove your worth to them.

The Absent-Minded Artisan : Of all the foolhardy, misguided, exasperating...  <Guardian Kota snorts and stomps a hoof.>  But standing here does Sha'lor no good. We must find him and bring him back safely.  Come, meet me at the Autumnal Rise. We can survey the burrows below and see if there is any sign that he lives.

Baker's Dozen : Under this very tent, I've prepared delicacies that would make demigods cry tears of joy. I'm always in need of more baking supplies!  The brokers usually sell me eggs from parts near and far, but maybe this time you could help me out instead.  You familiar with gorm? Big insect-like creatures native to Ardenweald. Well, if you find me some eggs of theirs, I'll bake you up something nice in return!   Mama will even send Starchy to help you out.

The New Path : Today, a new paragon is anointed. And for the first time since the dawn of our realm, a temple is rededicated to represent our devotion to one another.  A new paragon, a new sigil, and a new path for all kyrian.  This ceremony shall be glorious indeed!
The Seal of Contrition : Preparations for the Seal are complete.  Go, insert it into the Crest. Be delicate, yet firm! Move with purpose, but a steady hand.

The Prince's New Crown : The crown is ready. I will entrust you to deliver it to Renathal.  Make haste, <name>. This power will surely attract assailants if word gets out.  You may use the mirror to return. Know that I will be dispatching others to destroy it after your arrival.   Safe travels, Maw Walker.
RSVP: Stonehead : Hi, best bud!  Me no go party.   <Stonehead shakes his head vigorously.>  Got to stay for job!

A Day in the Life : A Bearer's duty is to carry souls through the veil to Oribos, where they shall be judged and passed along to one of the realms of the Shadowlands.  This soul is ready to move on.  During this trial, you will experience his final moments before his death.  When you are prepared, you shall see how this soul passed.

Ascended : With success over their trials, our aspirants shall now start the next chapter of their afterlives.  They have proven themselves through eons of training and cleansing, and will now earn ascendance.  As each aspirant is called, I ask you and Pelagos to please assist by ushering them up. It is a tradition we have practiced for eons, reinforcing the bonds that we share.

Maw Walker : I believe now it is time for you to leave.  You are a Maw Walker, one who can activate the waystone between the Maw and the lands beyond. While your friends may not hold the same title, there is a way to send them through the gate.   Souls can be connected. In theory, if you let someone attune themselves to your soul while you activate the waystone, you both should be able to leave. Even fleeting connections may produce some result.  Go with your other two guests and see if my hypothesis is correct.

Hunting an Inquisitor : You may have noticed that inquisitors are protected by the Lord Chamberlain's magic. A potent consequence of wielding the Master's medallion.  But now that we have access to Inquisitor Traian's sinstone from the archives, we have the power needed to break through those defenses.  Locate the inquisitor, and order Temel to read out from his sinstone. Declaring the true name and sins of the inquisitor will shatter his defenses and make him vulnerable for a short window of time.  Be ready to strike.

What's My Motivation? : Now for our finale! A thrilling performance of the most recent trials on Azathoth!  <Featherlight checks his notes.>  Azeroth. Whatever. It features an artificial god, a powerful magic ice princess, an infamous queen, and an eldritch abomination of unspeakable terror! Who doesn't love a good drama with a dash of existential horror?  You're back to playing yourself, so just... do whatever heroes are supposed to do!

Harvester of Wrath : We walk in the winged shadows of my brothers and sisters in arms, Stoneborn I have trained since they were first carved from stone.  This is an ancient rite. If we cross this bridge on foot, defeating any who would dare stop us, we may have an audience with the mother of the stoneborn. However, know that our safe return is not guaranteed, so try not to offend her.  I do not look forward to this.

Trading Favors: Spires of Ascension : The Kyrians of Bastion serve a unique role in the Shadowlands, ferrying mortal souls from their realms to ours. They are able to do so in great numbers, it would seem, in times of crisis or devastation.  We would like to know more about their travels to the realms beyond.   Surely one of them has brought something back from another land? They are, after all, so very interested in memories.

Unknown Assailants : This must be the stone he found. I do not recognize the mark.You should bring this to the nearby droman. They are wise and retain much of the knowledge of the forests and the realms beyond. They will know what to do.

Settling Disputes : In my search to find kyrian that would fit our purposes here, I have landed on two in particular -- Pelodis and Nemea.  However, the two are involved in quite the rivalry, and struggle to focus their attention elsewhere. I propose that you aid them in settling their dispute so that they may focus on the task at hand.  I doubt they shall work together, however, so you will need to pick one to aid us.

The Temple of Purity : Greetings.  I am Kosmas, Disciple to the Temple of Purity.  The temple is a place of cleansing. Its sole purpose is to free aspirants of the burdens they carry with them from life. It is a place of quiet reflection even for those who have shed their burdens.  Of late, those who look to us for purification have grown numerous. My fellow disciples are stretched terribly thin. I have come to ask the aid of all able-minded aspirants.  Your help is needed. Please report to the Hand of Purity at once.

Torment Chamber: Jaina : <Bolvar studies the objects you acquired from the brokers in Torghast.>  I sense Lady Proudmoore's magic upon this debris. And these notes describe methods to contain her power.  <The Highlord focuses on the items, peering into the darkness.>  By the Light! They are tormenting her with white-hot fires. Though her will is strong, there is only so much any mortal can endure.  I will modify Ve'nari's Attuned Shard using the items you returned.  You must find her, $p. Before it is too late.

Abominable Stitching and Me : Constructs have formed the backbone of Maldraxxi armies in more wars than anyone can count. A well-constructed body can turn any soul into a potent frontline weapon.  There is an old abominable stitching table outside of the sanctum that could be used to build our own constructs. With the anima you've secured for our covenant, we should be able to restore it.  Report to Miggsie once the work has begun. You can find her at Butchers Block.

Night Fae Veteran : Ardenweald is safer than it has been in quite some time, thanks to you.  Your accomplishments have not gone unnoticed, even beyond the borders of Ardenweald.  Tales of your victories have echoed through the halls of Oribos. Zo'sorg, the Master of Conflict, has requested a meeting with you in the Enclave.  They have a keen interest in the art of war. I suggest you don't keep them waiting.
Shoveltusk Soul : <The Shoveltusk Soul is protective and determined. The shape of the shoveltusk will be yours to call upon.>

Spirit-Gathering Labor : You are not like the others.The waters here carry deep power. Power most have forgotten. But the tirnenn forget very little.Power flows through the earth just as water flows with power. Flows can be trapped for a time, dripping. Drop by drop they drip into vessels.Search for the vessels beneath the falls. Collect the power.

Breaking Down Barriers : As I suspected, Stitchflesh's assistants are carrying on his work. Whatever they're building, we need to destroy it.  They've secured the chamber with a soul barrier and several bile spewers. We must find a way through!  Thales said he may have a suggestion.

A Proper Reception : Though the path you follow is not that of a traditional ascended, it is a kyrian path all the same.  To follow it is to bask in the footsteps of the innumerable lives before us, forever in service to a good far greater than we can achieve alone.  To join us amidst such strife is an accomplishment worthy of recognition. Our Archon has called all among us to join her in welcoming you to our ranks.

The Queen's Request : Dire portents indeed.   I have used what little anima we possess to save our groves and the spirits they nurture. So many were lost... all as the Heart of the Forest grew ever weaker.  Keeping the Banished One bound within the Maw will require more anima than Ardenweald can spare.  <The Queen considers for a moment.>  Sire Denathrius is a master of anima extraction. Journey to Revendreth and inform him of our plight. I know he will lend us his aid.  Your allies in Oribos can open the way.

Dude, Where's My Necropolis? : Maintaining the portal between our sanctum and the Zerekriss is a difficult task. With enough resources, we could make it permanent and become the unstoppable force my baroness wishes us to be.  She has asked much of you, as have I. But this work will make your name a legend among the Maldraxxi, as my baroness's has become.  Help to empower us, and you will be empowered in turn.

Report to Adrestes : You have chosen well.  The Kyrian have long ferried souls across the veil into the Shadowlands, ensuring a steady supply of anima for all the realms.  Their sacred purpose must be kept strong. Speak with Polemarch Adrestes and begin your future with your covenant.

Herald Their Demise : Since the dawn of Revendreth, Temel has been charged with proclaiming the sins of souls for all to hear.  Every soul here, including venthyr, has been forced to endure his wrathful pronouncements on at least one occasion.  He will know how to wield Inquisitor Stelia's sinstone to break through her defenses.  Simply command him to do so after you locate the inquisitor, and eliminate her.

The Forest Has Eyes : That dream! With the teeth and the claws and the heart... heart-wrenching sacrifice?  <Moonberry chokes up for a moment then collects herself.>  Sorry! While we were in dreamland, possessed spies have snuck into Hibernal Hollow!   They must be hunted down and slain before they can report back on the grove's defenses.  Here, borrow a bit of my magic. Seek out the ones hidden in the shadows and smite them!

The Mnemonic Locus : <Mikanikos examines the scroll you retrieved for him.>  Right, right.  Soul mirrors and Locus are tied together. If we restore anima to mirrors, it should repair the Locus back to full functionality. Thankfully, the cores you brought should be sufficient.  All I need to do is enable conduits. Simple!  Well? Go on. You know how to use these, yes?

Nox Root : In order to perform the ritual, I will need some nox root from Darkreach.  It is a unique plant that only grows within soil that has been corrupted by Drust magic.  Darkreach lies to the west, not far from my den. What was once a peaceful, verdant grove is now filled with blight and ruin.  I will travel to the Heart of the Forest to prepare the ritual. Meet me there when you have gathered the nox root.

Misery Business : The Mawsworn have begun harvesting the misery of the souls flowing through Gorgoa, the river of souls.  Why? I do not know yet. But it behooves us to stop them.  Destroy the conduits that they deposit the misery into and bring me some samples of their work.   Perhaps with some research, I can discern their intentions.

Renny the Vulpin : <The small vulpin kit runs up to you with a cheerful bounce and an air of mischief.  You, it seems, are interesting. Interesting enough that this child of Lord Renard of the Court of Winter has decided to tag along with you.  What could possibly go wrong?>

Hazardous Waste Collection : Ah, slimes: the dearest of friends and infinitely useful! They will help us craft our potion.  But it seems our tools have been scattered around, doused in toxic refuse. Margrave Stradama would be so disappointed at my lack of respect for lab safety!  Your slime can comb through the refuse, diluting the plague's harmful agents. Simply pull the cleaned equipment from the body of your slime!  Slimes... what would we do without them?

Confronting Sin : Thanks to the raid launched against Castle Nathria, we have obtained an opportunity.  A soul, powerful and fused with dark purpose at the hands of the Master's experiments.   Given this soul is from Azeroth, the Accuser has asked for your assistance in untwining the corruption done to his sinstone.  the Accuser awaits you in the lower levels of Sinfall.

In Death We Are Truly Tested : Vyraz is the one who trapped me within the Maw. He has long been in league with the House of Rituals and the House of Constructs.  No doubt he intended to trap you within that hellish place as well.  It is time he be brought to justice for his treason. Stand with me, and we will face him as one.

Bet On Yourself : Dear Maw Walker... my friend... you're going to lose. Everyone knows you can't compete in the arena.   The entire Challenger's Promenade knows it, the brokers in Oribos know it, even Zo'umlo knows it.  I've brought in a special challenger just to prove the point. Face Ti'or in the Theater of Pain and prove us wrong... or prove us right.  We will be betting, so don't disappoint.

Medallion of Wrath : Maw Walker. I will march with my stoneborn into the depths of the Maw and rend the head off every nathrezim I find there.  However, Revendreth is still too strategic in this war to lose out of misplaced vanity.   Therefore, as Harvester of Wrath, the second of that title, I offer you my medallion for safe keeping and utilization while I wage this war.  Use it to empower the Harvesters so they can prevent Denathrius from simply returning and regaining control with a snap of his fingers.

The First Cleansing : This situation may feel familiar, <name>.  When you found Pelagos, he was undergoing a similar rite. As you saw, it can end in violence.  This will be the first time you are asked to draw out the burdens that held you to a mortal life. It may be a painful process. It is for many.  For you, this is the path you must walk to attain your goals. To earn the right to stand among us, to be heard. So we may carry your message to the Archon herself.  Center yourself. When you are prepared, we will begin.

The Heart of Ardenweald : I hid my sigil in the Heart of the Forest, to keep it safe from the forces of the Maw.  But the horn has called for aid.  You and your allies go, see what has prompted the call.

Fighting For Fungus : Behold, Marasmius!  This is his home, his heart. Every mushroom in Ardenweald, maybe even all of the Shadowlands, stems from here. And the masked fae want to take him for their own purposes. As chief mushroomancer, I cannot abide this.  Our foes may look mindless, but they are clever. They will have tracked my position by now.  I shall make my final stand here, and hope that Marasmius is strong enough to lend his aid.  Will you stand with me, <class>?

Convene the Paragons : We have defeated the Forsworn at every turn. Saved those not too far gone. Routed them from our blessed Archon's temples. Now only one remains.  The Temple of Loyalty.  Lysonia has grown desperate in defeat. Abandoned all we strive to uphold by embracing the Maw. She has rallied her most fervent loyalists to the temple, knowing we will come for her.  We shall need the Paragons to finish this. Summon them.

The Aspirant's Crucible : I have given Kalisthene's words some thought.  If you are to learn our ways, we should proceed as if you were an aspirant yourself. The next step is to journey through the Aspirant's Crucible.  It is a place of reflection, training, and cleansing. For an aspirant, it is where they prepare for the long journey ahead. For you... I hope you will learn how you might help us in this time of crisis.  Word of your arrival has likely spread. We will not keep them waiting.  Take my steed, and go in service.
Box of Torments : <The insidious music box hums an endlessly repeating set of dissonant chords.   Ve'nari may find it melodious.>

Continued Efforts: Mauler's Outlook : My Eyes tell me that the Mauler's Outlook is near the newly formed road from the Maw into Korthia. It would provide a strategic and tactical advantage.  Unfortunately, the area is overrun with shardhides.  If we can secure the area, it will provide us with a clear path to the west, as well as a point of observation to monitor the Jailer's forces.

Save Ol' Gertie : We have to find Ol' Gertie! She is the broodmother of the silkstriders, and is our most reliable producer. We cannot lose her.  But I cannot get to her and see if she is all right. She is usually at the top of the cliffs, at the highest point. Can you get up there, and make sure that she is safe?  If she is not... then may justice fall swift and hard on the perpetrator.

Can't Turn Our Backs : That's Sylvanas and her Mawsworn dealt with... for now.  But we need to hurry and make sure that the Queen and her sigil are safe!   The Winter Queen was just outside the Heart of the Forest, protecting the stolen wildseeds from the Maw.

De Other Side : Ay, dere <name>! Ya be just da <class> I've been lookin' for!  It be your ol' pal Bwonsamdi reachin' out ta ya from De Other Side! I be havin' a little problem over here wit' de boss...  Ya be lookin' mighty bored just standin' around here in Ardenweald. Why don't ya come to De Other Side and help out an ol' friend? Bwonsamdi promise he gonna make it worth ya while!  Ya might want ta bring a few more adventurers wit' ya... just ta be safe.

A Land of Strife : It is imperative that you identify the cause of the attack on Bastion.  We will require your aid to open the gateway. Once the focus is sufficiently powered, we will call upon the gate to Maldraxxus and direct it into position.  From there, the fate of this war must rest upon your shoulders.

By Any Other Name : Excellent work, my apprentice! Our laboratory is back in working order!  Now, there is one final ingredient we require to complete our potion for Margrave Stradama.  You will need to run along to the greenhouse. I've cultivated a sprig of dreadshade that should be ready to harvest.  I will prepare the other reagents while you're away. Be safe, apprentice!

A Perilous Journey : Mograine has rallied the House of the Chosen to strike at Margrave Gharmal and his House of Constructs. They grow in strength with each passing day--this may be our only chance.  We will join them on the field of battle. We will have justice for the fallen at my temple, as well as Mograine's own fallen kin.  Rendezvous at Spider's Watch within Maldraxxus' northern reaches. We will move from there.

Regalia de Rigueur : Ah, if it isn't Kel'Thuzad's favorite acolyte? I simply cannot understand how a baron like him would surround himself with such... homely company.  When was the last time you even chanced at a looking glass? Those faded robes do your station no justice.  I would take it upon myself to update your drab apparel, if I weren't sufferring such a shortage on the house's preferred amethystine tint.  You could always fetch some yourself. The sorcerers usually have some stashed among their tomes and altars.

Better Off Dead : Our defense is tenuous at best, but the enemy is still hesitant to attack.  As long as they fear us, they won't be probing our defenses.   You must keep the pressure on the enemy.  Attack their positions all along our line.

Awaken the Dreamer : Much of the Queen's focus has centered on the Grove of Awakening, where rejuvenated spirits emerge from their wildseeds and return to their worlds.  Perhaps it is fitting you carry a wounded spirit with you.  <Lord Herne studies Ysera's wildseed for a moment before a slow grin spreads across his face.>  This one fights with all of her being. Even now she clings to existence.   Come, stranger, let us see what fate the Queen will decree for this one.

A Doorway Through the Veil : The Helm fragment connected us while you were in the Maw. As if through a darkened pane of glass, I saw glimpses of what you endured. The terrors you faced.  At least the heroes of Azeroth yet live. They must be saved.  By affixing the Helm here, you gave us a tether to Azeroth that served to bring a few of us across the veil. But you, and other heroes who join us, require a stronger connection.  Our acolytes can open portals back. No doubt these attendants will be particular about their placement.
Supplies from The Wild Hunt : The Wild Hunt thanks you for your efforts in aiding Ardenweald.  Take these gifts as recognition for your aid. May they help you in whatever trials may come.

Into the Maw : I have not seen Tyrande since she departed for Icecrown... but I see her in my dreams. She stalks a nightmarish landscape, brimming with the might of the Night Warrior.  Such power is too much for any mortal to bear for long. I shudder to think of the toll it has taken on my minn'do.  Highlord Fordragon has told me of the Maw. If you truly have braved its horrors before, then I ask that you guide me through them as well.  We must find Tyrande and convince her to let go of the Night Warrior's rage.

Repair and Restore : You've already attuned several mirrors without incident. I do believe it's time you try your hand at repairing them instead.  It's quite easy once you've found the fragments, but there are a few things of note to keep in mind.   Repaired mirrors are fragile and unpredictable. They often break with a single use, and it's never a guarantee that using one will translocate you somewhere safe.   Here's a few shards to get you started.   Restore the mirror to working order and see where it leads.

Ember Court: Mystery Mirrors : I support Prince Renathal's efforts and will certainly help the Ember Court!  Mystery mirrors will be dangerous but add real excitement to the party. I will need a lot of mirror fragments to complete enough of them in time.  You will also need to refresh my supply of Ashen Cores so I can get the glass sufficiently molten to work.

The Traitor Unmasked : We must waste no time in warning the margrave of Kel'Thuzad's treachery. His reckless toying with forbidden powers could bring ruin to the house and beyond!  Let us put an end to this!
Return More Lost Souls : Souls continue to pour into the Maw.   I see no reason you cannot pull even more souls from the abyss.  Return to the Maw and find me even more worthy of redemption.

A Common Peril : Each house in Maldraxxus has two barons. Before the fall of my first house--the House of Eyes--our margrave sent my fellow baroness to investigate suspicious behavior in the House of Rituals.  I have not heard from her since. Either she has found something... or has become another casualty of their treachery.   Her orders took her to the Decay in the east. If you can find the baroness, give her this summons.   We were not friends, she and I, but she is a formidable combatant. We could use her might.

Hunting Amid Houses : I have dreamed that Tyrande Whisperwind is crucial to the survival of Ardenweald.  The night fae have been searching for others like her who were once Night Warriors. We have recruited an ancient ally of Azeroth, Huln Highmountain, in order to look for them.  Elune's power is too much for any mortal to contain--even Tyrande. I do not know how much longer she can hold on.  Allow me to explain further, then you must hurry to meet Huln in Maldraxxus.

Ember Court: Atoning Rituals : If Prince Renathal wishes to impart knowledge of Revendreth's highest calling to his guests, we would be honored to demonstrate the rituals of atonement.  However, I must ask for your assistance preparing the necessary components quickly.  Capture nearby fugitive souls that hide from the Lord Chamberlain's corrupt venthyr. Bring them to our avowed ritualists across the halls. They will prepare the souls for our purpose.  Sinstone fragments will also help us identify the sins of these lost souls.

You Cannot Run : Zelmany was integral in the fall of my Margrave.  Sin'Dane believes he is trying to gather forces loyal to Kel'Thuzad so they might help him in his next plot.  We should look for clues to his location and then slay him.

Home Improvement : I've been finkin' of a bit of ways we could improve the place, but since you brought in all of the anima and souls to do it, I fink you should be the one to decide which improvement we start on first.  Don't get overwhelmed. As you bring in more anima and find more willin' souls, we'll be able to bring more capabilities to the place. For now, a single upgrade will fit the bill.

The Wards of Bastion : Each temple of Bastion is protected by a ward here in Elysian Hold. As long as the wards hold, no malevolent force can launch an assault.  It is concerning that the Forsworn were able to attack Purity in such force...  Your orders are to examine the wards. As long as they hold, Bastion stands strong.

Path of Ascension: Artemede's Challenge : Are you prepared for a challenge, <name>?  Though most kyrian have their preferences, every kyrian must learn to fight with a multitude of weapons and equipment. This allows them to keep both their minds sharp and their muscles and movements honed.  Let us see how your soulbinds fare against the memory of Kalisthene while utilizing the Spiritforged Aegis.

Mirror Attunement: The Eternal Terrace : Work has been completed on a mirror that will allow travel between Sinfall and The Eternal Terrace. However, it has yet to be attuned.  The attunement process is quite simple. Just head to the mirror's location in the world, and pass through it once, returning to Sinfall. When you have done so, travel between the two mirrors should be seamless.

Mark of Knowledge : There is another matter for which I need your assistance. My researchers and interrogators have been tirelessly working on the second chamber. So far they don't have any leads.  I need you to speak to them and see if they've made any progress. Tell them, if they have nothing to show, then they will soon find themselves at the end of my sword.  Get me that mark, quartermaster!

The Greater Good : The Forsworn are our former brothers and sisters in arms...our former kin. But we must see this through.  We will hit them from all sides. Fight well, but do not forget that Lysonia is our ultimate objective. If she does not fall, then she will recruit more to their cause in time.  Follow the path, <name>.

A Brokered Deal : Hey, <name>. I've found a lucrative business proposition that'll help me... us... greatly! See, Au'narim is willing to give us supplies if we can help him recover from a trade deal that went sideways.  Apparently, several of his cohorts never returned from a job. He needs us to follow their path and recover the item they failed to deliver. Simple, right?  To ensure we don't have any mishaps, I've taken the liberty of acquiring a few items that may be of help to us.  So, you in?

Tending to the Tenders : The eggs are a problem, but so are the gorm that take care of them.The egg-tenders are the leaders of the hive when no matriarch is present. If left unchecked, they will simply produce more eggs and we will be right back where we started. Or worse, one of them could turn into a queen. They are simply too large and hostile for us to properly contain. I see no other recourse than to put them down.

De-Infiltration : Mal'Ganis.  It has been many ages since I have said his name. And now I find we must hunt him down.  If he has the Medallion of Wrath then there is nowhere he can hide. We can use the other medallions we have recovered to locate him.  Join me in Sinfall and bring your dreadlord hunting party. I suspect we will have need of them.
The Brand Holds the Key : <Darion is unresponsive. The cage is locked, and doesn't appear easily broken.  Perhaps the holder of the key is this "Brand" he mentioned.>
Supplies from The Undying Army : Your efforts meet with the approval of The Undying Army.  These rewards are in recognition of those efforts. May they help you in the battles to come.

Assistance from Sinfall : In order to defeat the Forsworn, the Crest needs an artifact that embodies repentance, atoning for past mistakes and moving forward.  I have an artifact in mind.   Long ago, many souls from Revendreth arrived in Bastion. Purer souls than we have ever received from Revendreth.  They bore the mark of the Seal of Contrition, a focus that expedited their cleansing.  Go to Revendreth and find this seal so that we may harness its power.

End of the Dream : The time has come. The ritual will be complete when you have fully entered into the spirit's dreams.  It will be as if you are her, in every aspect.  She relives the moment of her death over and over again. It torments her. Something about how she ended... she had no control over her actions. She hurt the ones she loved.  Speak to me when you are ready to immerse yourself in her nightmare of the end.

The House of Plagues : The House of Plagues was the first to fall in this conflict. We believed its demise was the result of a careless accident. If only we had known the truth sooner...  But perhaps not all their knowledge was lost. Before you arrived, our scouts reported signs of movement near the wreckage of their necropolis.  If any survivors remain, we'd be wise to add them to our ranks. But approach with caution. The toxic fallout may have left them mad... or worse.

You Can Only Die : The last name on my list is a lich named Fal'zinge.  Sin'Dane has been keeping a close eye on him to learn more of what Kel'Thuzad is planning next.   She wishes for Fal'zinge's execution to be brutal.   We will find him in the Exoramas in the House of Rituals.

Path of Ascension: Echthra : Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.  Their sights this week are set on Echthra, that they may learn from the lessons her memory teaches.  When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Echthra to prove their growth.

The Broken Spear : <The shattered remains of a sylvari spear litter the ground. You recognize the spear as belonging to Ara'lon.  This confirms that Ara'lon was here. Unfortunately, he is nowhere to be found.  Lord Herne will want to know of your discovery.>

Do What We Cannot : Rumor has it that you've been to the Maw and back... and that you even made friends with a broker in there!   So many souls destined for Ardenweald are trapped in that dark realm.
