They need our help... and we need theirs! We can't cultivate the Heart of the Forest's magic without them.  I know this is a lot to ask... but you may be our only hope of rescuing them. Please, venture into the Maw and do what we cannot. Ardenweald's future depends on it!

Someone Worth Saving : Are you familiar with Kael'thas Sunstrider? He was a powerful leader on your world for a time.  The immense anima of that lingering power attracted the Master's attention, to the eternal detriment of Kael'thas's soul.  <The Accuser's lip curls in disgust.>  Every soul deserves a chance at redemption, $p.  If you do not believe that, believe me when I say that this soul is immensely powerful and still at risk of self-destruction.  Release him so that we may walk his path of redemption together.

Defending the Vault : To reach the vault, we'll need to carve a path through the attacking Mawsworn.  The covenants are doing their best to drive off these monstrosities, but our allies can't hold out forever. The Mawsworn are intent on reaching the prize before you.  We could use your help fighting against the Jailer's forces, Maw Walker.  Purpose guide us all.

Ulfar's Guidance : There is one who may know how to dispel the curse from Gweyir.  In the mountains of Drustvar lives Ulfar, an ancient Thornspeaker who sided with the humans of Kul Tiras against his fellow Drust.  Journey to his den and ask for his wisdom. He may hold the answers you seek.  Lord Herne and I will tend to Gweyir once she arrives with Ara'lon.

Ember Court: Mushroom Surprise! : I had not realized the fame of my fungi had reached so far. I'd be delighted to provide a mushroom feast to the Ember Court!  Hmmm... I will need you to collect some rare specimens and will loan you my favorite foraging bag. It will help you find the very best fungi. It's never failed me.  Let's see, I need tiny lacy bells from Bastion and some of those Ardenweald fancy purple frills. From the very tops of our mushrooms here I will need the feather caps. You'll need to grapple your way up there.

How to Catch a Glimmerfly : Yes! Proper tools collected. Now to catch glimmerflies!  Anima drought more severe in northern pools. Many Starving Glimmerflies, most eager to drink from our animyllis blooms.  Place blooms, then while glimmerflies are drinking attach to filaments! Then return to me.

Break a Leg : The show is about to begin! You... that's what you're going to wear? Well, I suppose it works.  For your grand introduction, we will re-enact recent victories and events that took place on Azzinoth. Er, Azeroth. That's where you're from, right?  The Starlight Company has graciously volunteered to assist us in this production. We've recruited some special guests as well!   Don't worry about the script. This is your story, after all!  Just try not to get too much blood on stage. It's hard to clean.

Filling an Empty Throne : Maw Walker.  In my long absence, you have done much to bring order and strength back to the necrolord covenant. In recognition, I invite you to witness a ceremony.  Return with me to my seat of power in Maldraxxus. It is time I rewarded one who was most loyal to our cause.

Bone Tools : So the device we need to open this vault is stuck on a floating island, eh?  Not a problem.  I see plenty of sturdy creatures around here. Like I always say, no bone goes to waste!  Bring me a pile of their bones. I'll use them to craft hookshot points for us to use to grapple over there.

Path of Ascension: Athanos : Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.  Their sights this week are set on Athanos, that they may learn from the lessons his memory teaches.  When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Athanos to prove their growth.

A Test of Courage : I'm still new and haven't passed all of my Aspirant tests. But, I have an idea.  There is an artifact called Korinna's Allaying Crook. Korinna was a powerful Ascended who tamed the creatures of Bastion eons ago. Her staff has the power to prevent more creatures from succumbing to a savage, anima-starved state.  However, the artifact is protected and only one with great courage can retrieve it. I bet you could, <name>.  Go on ahead. The staff is in the reliquary to the north. I'll join you there shortly.

The Vessels of Jewels : You have the bearing of a lapidary. Though familiar with the art of jewelcraft, perhaps there is yet more to learn.  Vessels that hold the power of the runes can be crafted by a hand such as yours. But this I cannot teach you.  Hmm, there is a way. I will entrust you with a memory of my recipes for the vessels. Take it to a master of your craft and they will show you the way.  What's that? Do not worry. It is merely an echo of my memory. What you restored to me remains intact.

The Professionals : Smart move bringing in the specialists, $p.  Once you get into this week's Ember Court, be sure to let the specialists know what you want them to do.  Breakfist down in the dredger pools can smash or clean things to make the court more Messy or Clean for you.  Crooked Crick in the refreshments area can adjust Decadence.  Lady Ilinca in the embassy area can adjust Formality.  Cosmin the Illusionist on stage can adjust Excitement.  Wing Commander Vulpek at the front gates can adjust Danger.

Unbroken Bonds : The Drust will pay for this foul curse that they've unleashed upon us.  We have lost too many allies... too many friends to give up now. Even though we cannot save those who have fallen into possession, we can end their torment. I will instruct the hunt to put down all possessed they encounter.  Please deliver this report to the Winter Queen. She must be told what we have learned.  Thank you for your service, <name>. You are a true friend and guardian of Ardenweald.
Alpaca Soul : <The Alpaca Soul is wary and alert. The shape of the alpaca will be yours to call upon.>

A Perfect Circle : I've come up with the perfect design to fit your needs--a crown capable of channeling the powers of the Harvesters.  I need one more tool to put it together, a mold. Circular objects difficult to get right.  Go up to my old storage. A perfect mold exists there. I'm sure of it.  Perhaps in one of my old trunks. Go rummage around for it, will you?
Supplies from The Ascended : The Ascended would like to thank you for your efforts in aiding Bastion.  Please accept a gift in recognition of your service to our cause and our people.
A Light Touch : Need Firstborne's Light! You know?  Named after Archon! Always in water. Kofi's favorite!  Shine big light when grown. And go to shore! Easy to see!

The Wayward Baron : It has come to my attention that you seek to uncover a plot by the baron Kel'Thuzad.   That upstart has been a thorn in my side since he arrived at the House of Rituals. Not only did he pilfer my rightfully earned title, he has since shut me out of the house's dealings.  I have yet to find evidence that would mar Sin'dane's adoration for her new baron, and thus I offer an arrangement. I grant you access to the House of Rituals, and in return you help me bring down Kel'Thuzad.  Do we have an accord?

Doing the Dew : The Thistledrop is magnificent creature. The roots go deep into the earth where they drink of waters most ancient. With these waters they collect the very essence of the land into a drop of dew that enables our artisans to craft powerful armaments.  Help us gather the dew and you will be well rewarded.  Hurry, before it evaporates!

The Vesper Rings : Loyalty shall no longer be a demanded tenet of the Path, but rather a virtue that is earned. A choice.  We must show devotion to those who struggle, whether they are recently arrived souls or peers who need our aid.  It will take all the anima at hand to rededicate this temple. And in so doing, to ring in a new age for the kyrian.  I fear the Mawsworn may attempt to thwart our plans. Protect me during this ritual, <name>. We must see this through.

Servant of N'Zoth : <class>...  I have watched you... I have felt your bloodlust.   But you serve false prophets... the Alliance is an illusion... I am a god!  Prove to me you are worthy of my gift... kill those who are to betray you...  Kill... the Alliance!

The Old Ways : You there! Might I ask your help?  I must confess, with the lack of new souls arriving, our supplies have dwindled. We lack the means to clothe arrivals in proper kyrian attire.  Before the forging of the centurions, aspirants trained against the native wildlife. Perhaps there is another way these beasts can prove useful.  If you collect materials from the cloudstriders and larions nearby, we can use them to ensure our new arrivals look the part.  Oh, and some thread from Mirene, if you would!

Keepers of Korthia : We've barely held out against the Jailer's forces. Now that you're here, we can finally make some progress.  I know your priority is to enter the vault, but our record keepers must also be recovered.   They are the authorities about everything kept in the vault. We can't let the Jailer learn what they know.
Functioning Anima Core : <The incomprehensible core whirs with a pleasant hum.   Surely someone would have a use for this? >

Rezan, Loa of Kings : Rezan be a powerful loa, one of great importance ta da Zandalari.  We need ta rescue him... but dis creature be projectin' a barrier of death. Notin' be gettin' in.  Unless... I be usin' me own anima ta shield ya from its magic.  Ya gotta act fast and kill da monster dat be drainin' Rezan. Me anima not gonna last forever.  Say da word when ya ready ta go.

Obelisk of Dark Tidings : <Your familiarity with the Archivists' Codex makes it clear that this is one of the missing relics.  Archivist Roh-Suir has a spot for this obelisk in the Reliquary of Remembrance.>

A Friendly Rivalry : Ah, a fresh soul! Your perspective may prove useful to us.  Nemea and I have opposing viewpoints. She lauds her larion, creatures native to Bastion whom she raises and trains as her companions.  However, I find that phalynx are the superior beings. They are efficient, obedient, and easy to work with.  Please, come learn both of our ways. Perhaps you can decide which of our ways of life is superior.
Supplies from Death's Advance : Your work toward stopping the Jailer's advances has not gone unnoticed. If it is power you seek to continue your efforts I believe I can be of some assistance.
Ve'rayn's Head : <Ve'rayn has been hunting Ve'nari for some time. Ve'nari would be very interested in seeing proof that she has been dealt with permanently.>

Legend of the Animaswell : <This appears to be an incomplete set of notes detailing one archivist's search for a mythical font of anima hidden somewhere deep in Korthia.  Koros in Elysian Hold would be able to help you put together a team to search for it.>

Advancing Our Efforts : A venthyr's primary responsibility is ensuring that souls are unburdened of their pride, but they must see to other matters as well.   We must act beyond the bounds of Revendreth to ensure that the souls of the Shadowlands keep to their fate.  Allow me to demonstrate with a simple task for your companion here. This will be the first of many strikes.

Drink to the Dead : The Forsworn are ravaging the temples of Bastion, and the aspirants are leaving behind their supplies as they flee.  All those wonderful bottles of nectar falling into the hands of the Forsworn? I think not!   There's no way we can save all of the aspirants, but we can keep the Forsworn from taking those supplies. Besides... we could all use something to drink around here.

Kivarr's Den : Kivarr... I have not heard that name in many an age.  She used to make her home near Eventide Grove to the south. Ara'lon knows the area well. I suggest you take him with you.  I fear that the situation with Gweyir weighs heavily upon him. Perhaps joining you on the hunt will do him some good.
Crane Soul : <The Crane Soul dances with grace. The shape of the crane will be yours to call upon.>

Lead the Way : We must move now. That won't be the last assassin we face.  I can provide some cover of darkness, but mind that the spell is not infallible.  Enough talking. The Curator needs us and my mirror shard to get to her as soon as possible.

Mending a Broken Hart : We have all the reagents for the counter-curse!  Hurry up and cast it before Qadarin's soul is lost, and Thiernax refuses to help you, and Tyrande is doomed to die horribly in the Maw, and everyone is sad!  But no pressure.

Kyrian Assault : The Jailer's forces  have been caught off guard by our attack. We shall overrun Perdition Hold and defeat his champions at the Altar of Domination!  Your help is needed Maw Walker. Assist our forces on the battlefield!
No Wisp Left Behind : More of the Kaldorei souls still languish in the Maw.  I ask you once again, Maw Walker, to find them.  Help correct this wrong.

Mirror Attunement: Pridefall Hamlet : Work has been completed on a mirror that will allow travel between Sinfall and Pridefall Hamlet. However, it has yet to be attuned.  The attunement process is quite simple. Just head to the mirror's location in the world, and pass through it once, returning to Sinfall. When you have done so, travel between the two mirrors should be seamless.
Calling in All Favors : $p, the time has come.  We cannot allow Kel'Thuzad to wield the Ritualists' sorcery as a weapon. He must be destroyed.  Rally our forces. We march on the House of Rituals!

Success Without Soul : The larions seem to truly enjoy your company, Andira most of all.  I hope you've come to understand and appreciate the nuance of working with a beast with free will.  Now you must spend time with Pelodis, down the hill. His phalynx may be effective, but working with them only brings hollow satisfaction.  I am sure working with the phalynx will only strengthen your appreciation of larions.

We Need a Healer - You! : There are too many wounded on the battlefield!   Not everyone can 'bash it and make better.' We need more healers.  You, take my device and get our wounded back on their feet!

A Reflection of Truth : I sent the Fearstalker far from here with that trap--buying us some time.  On the other side of this mirror lies the depths of Castle Nathria, the fortress of Denathrius himself. There, a meeting between Denathrius and one of his lackeys is about to take place.  Join me through the mirror, <name>. You shall see the truth of this "drought" first hand.

Skin in the Game : This task is probably above your capabilities, but listen anyway.  As a construct I was feared throughout the Shadowlands. The magnificent skin of my construct was impervious to mortal weapons, it was a work of art that took years to perfect.  When I was removed from my construct, it was Faldo Iscar who took great delight in stealing that skin. He keeps it on himself as a souvenir.  Kill Faldo Iscar, and get my skin back!

Reconnaissance... for my, uh, Recovery : It appears I am at your mercy once more, $p.  Far be it from me to tell you the best way to absolve my sins as the Accuser insists we do.  However...  In that note, the Tithelord arranged a meeting with his contact in Darkhaven. Do you know where that is?  If you do, we could investigate, gather more information, and present that information to the Accuser and Prince Renathal.  I imagine that would be quite useful to them.  And a very selfless act of assistance on my part, do you not agree?

Rebuild Our Trust : Well <name>, it seems you are serious about earning your way back into our good graces.  It seems you are serious about this penance. This task should prove your willingness to rejoin our ranks.

A Conduit for Good : While the gifts your bond shall bring you are substantial, you may also empower yourself further through the use of conduits.  Conduits act to channel the energy of your soulbind into your form more directly, increasing your potential in a myriad of ways.  Use the ones I have given you as a test of this power, but fear not--you will find others as you aid the Shadowlands.

Words of Warding : The towering citadel in the distance is protected by perilous walls, but its greatest dangers cannot be seen with mortal eyes.  The Mawsworn have placed invisible runes of warding throughout Perdition Hold. These traps have caught many intruders unaware.  The runes can be dispelled, but only if you can see them. I believe one of their soulcloaks should give you the sight you require.  Good luck.

Path of Ascension: Thran'tiok : Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.  Their sights this week are set on Thran'tiok, that they may learn from the lessons her memory teaches.  When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Thran'tiok to prove their growth.

An Invitation to Treachery : While the missive made it clear that Andrei is displeased with my position, nothing in the letter identifies his co-conspirator.   All we really know is that they are trying to gain access to my soiree this evening so they can carry out their plans. Let's make it easy for them, shall we?   Head into the Redelav District and deliver an invite to the prominent houses. This way, we'll be sure the traitors show up.

Mirror Attunement: Dominance Keep : Work has been completed on a mirror that will allow travel between Sinfall and Dominance Keep. However, it has yet to be attuned.  The attunement process is quite simple. Just head to the mirror's location in the world, and pass through it once, returning to Sinfall. When you have done so, travel between the two mirrors should be seamless.

The Blue Seed : I remember seeing a blue seed with red leaves nearby, but it was in a cave behind a wall of brambles. I didn't think of it at the time, but maybe you could use the red seeds to get us in?  I wish I didn't mix up the instructions or we wouldn't be in this mess. But maybe it's all going to work out anyway. Let's go!

Path of Ascension: Craven Corinth : Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.  Their sights this week are set on Craven Corinth, that they may learn from the lessons his memory teaches.  When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Craven Corinth to prove their growth.
Hope Ascending : There is one final thing we must do.  Meet us atop the peak of Hope's Ascent.

I Intend to Live Forever : Please, <name>. I am not finished.  There is one more memory that I must see. One more that must be faced.  It... it will not be easy. I will need support from all of you.  But it must be done.
Blueprint: Charm of Fortitude : <You have discovered plans for a charm that seems to fortify your soulbinds in the Path of Ascension.  Dactylis should be able to help you with crafting this charm.>

Remnants of Hope : I studied the key you brought back from Torghast, <name>.  It confirms that Jaina Proudmoore is still being held somewhere in the tower. However we do not know precisely where.  Countless souls are captive inside that wretched place. A few may be intact, but many are shattered and broken.  Take pity upon the remnants and free those you can. Perhaps they will be able to aid our search.

A Monument to Vengeance : <Corpses of Ebon Blade knights litter the Crucible of the Damned, displaying the aftermath of your first foray into this desolate place.  Their sacrifice should not be forgotten.>

Side Effects : Scrapper Minoire's use of enhancers creates unpredictable betting implications. It is quite unhealthy... for our profits!  For a nominal fee, Au'larrynar can provide you with a "special" enhancer that Minoire will not be able to resist: a potion that turns the one who imbibes it into the ultimate combatant... and teaches them a lesson in restraint, as well.  I cannot wait to see Minoire's next match in the arena!

Hero's Rest : In light of the new arrivals to Bastion, Kalisthene has enabled the anima gateways to Hero's Rest once more!  Those wishing to partake of breathtaking views, unparalleled steward service, and all manner of training and repair facilities should venture to this most remarkable of locations at their earliest convenience.  Simply follow the path north and bear to the right at the crossroads.  Kalisthene will personally greet all new arrivals for this most joyous of occasions!
Gharmal's Tower : Gharmal collected anything they believed to be an item of power.  We'll need to search the tower. There is almost certainly something here of value to us.

Bring Out Your Tithe : Unfortunately the Lord Chamberlain's gift isn't sufficient to cover the entire tithe we're expected to provide the Tithelord, but it will make a good start.  The loss of the tithe convoy is a terrible blow to our village. Our little community is already suffering greatly from the drought and the need to meet the Tithelord's demands. Still we must all do our part.  We have little time to accomplish this task. Can you help? Get the tithe from villagers and scour the area for every forgotten drop.
Battleground Observers : Zo'sorg and the other brokers of Cartel Zo can be found just down the hall.  They will certainly be eager to hear that large-scale battles are included in the Purpose.

Wake Up, Get Up, Get Out There : They need your help!Not all of the faeries have been turned yet. Some remain prisoner, but they have these masks on their faces....You've got to help them! I'm not strong enough to pry off the masks, but you could! You could stop the guards from getting us too!

Distorted by the Maw : Lysonia's forces are rerouting the anima collectors to spew Maw energy across the temple. They hamper our forces while strengthening their own.  The collectors have been tainted. Take Compassion and destroy them to halt Lysonia's boon.

Cage Free Spores : I will need your assistance with the collection of one other reagent for your master. These spore clusters he requests--while normally a trivial matter--will require a bit of work.  You see, as the veilwing rampaged throughout the Reagentry, it toppled and broke several nearby cages hosting the blightrays from which we harvest the clusters.  You will have to collect them through more... conventional means.   The clusters are fragile, however, so try not to damage them while subduing the creatures.

Grinder : It's tough keeping these hands of mine razor sharp. With all the hacking and cleaving, they can grow dull so quickly! What's a girl to do?  The House of the Chosen makes some very fine quality sharpening stones. I doubt they will just hand them over, but I'm sure my blades can persuade them otherwise.  How about we pay them a visit and see how many stones they can spare?

Keeper of Great Renown : As you grow in renown across the Shadowlands, the Heart of the Forest shall grow with you.   Seek out Laurel, our Keeper of Renown. She will acquaint you with the magic that we bestow upon our huntsmen and huntresses.

Fight and Flight : Alexandros and Emeni will lead the Chosen assault on the western gate.   You and Xandria will direct your forces at the eastern gate. Secure the area and eliminate any resistance.   Once both flanks are secured we can attack Gharmal directly.

What's In a Memory? : It may be possible to extract memories from fragment, but I worry they will not be useful. This is not whole kyrian, but a tiny piece! A weird, broken piece. It cannot even speak!  We will apply extractor and see what comes out. Extractor might explode. It might not. For this? Worth the risk, I think.  Do not know what will emerge. Could be memories. Could be nothing. Could be something else. May try to fight you! Stay on your guard, yes? Collect all that look Forsworn.  Speak when ready.

Faith Through the Darkness : This drought is... so much larger than I imagined.  Why did nobody tell us?  The burden of this knowledge weighs heavy... do we bear souls to their eternal torture?  We must return home.

Path of Ascension: Kalisthene : Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.  Their sights this week are set on Kalisthene, that they may learn from the lessons her memory teaches.  When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Kalisthene to prove their growth.

A Desperate Solution : <A well-made, if well-worn, journal catches your eye.Thumbing through the pages, it is clear that this journal once belonged to someone prominent from this group of night fae. The last few pages are torn out of the book.Perhaps if the rest of the pages were located then Partik could help decipher what happened here.>

Conduits, What Are They For? : While the benefits of soulbinding are substantial, you may strengthen them further through the use of conduits.  Conduits act to channel the anima of our bond in a myriad of ways, vastly increasing both of our potential.  Let us test out the ones I have given you. Fear not--many others like it can be found throughout the Shadowlands.

Resource Drain : Usually repairs easy. Anima everywhere!  Except drought means we can't just pull it from air. Other sources needed!  Take this. Drain anima from cloudstriders. Not ideal, but desperate times.

Refining Ego : I will locate Phaestus. In the meantime, task for you!  The Forsworn use my forge to make their centurion army. Their vile intentions warp the metals we use!  Destroy their centurions, take their parts. Smelt them down in the forge to purify the metals, then return to me.  I need much metal for my plan.
...Why Me? : <The dense, chunky liquid inside the vessel emits a horrendous odor.  The initials O.K. are etched into the side. It seems someone stole Overseer Kalvaros' canteen.>

A Time for Courage : I know not what awaits us across the chasm, outsider. By the Archon's grace I hope that my Paragon yet lives, but I fear the worst.  We will face this great unknown together, as we have the rest of Maldraxxus's horrors. To be kyrian is to follow the path, no matter how dire the circumstances.  Whatever happens, know that you have earned my undying respect this day.

Practical Applications : Greetings, Maw Walker.  I am pleased to announce that we have accumulated the relevant research necessary to set up a Field Anima Diverter.  Please find a suitable location for it in the Reliquary, preferably where it will not be impacted by interference from other anima-charged relics.

He Was My Student : Uther's memories of this Prince Arthas haunt him deeply. He is the reason Uther's soul was fragmented, why Devos fell the way she did.  The pain in these memories is palpable.  We have to dig deeper. Uther must face the source of this darkness.  Once again, you need to enter his past to protect his future.

A Sacrifice of Anima : The last thing we need for this counter-curse is some attuned anima.  Of course, we don't have much to spare. That means this is more of a sacrifice than it normally would be.  But you know what? The spriggans made this mess, so they should help clean it up. Some really nasty ones have been causing mischief in Tirna Scithe. They should have the anima we need.  Thiernax looks like he could use some nice, vengeful, therapeutic spriggan stomping. I'll have him meet you there.

Pardon Our Dust : Ah yes, the Greeter.  It seems this Mnemis unit has been deactivated. Anima has been so scarce of late, and with no new souls entering our gates... I suppose it was a prudent measure. Anima is our most precious resource, after all.  There are some centurions nearby. A portion of their Anima could serve our needs.  Ah! One of our most helpful stewards is here to lend her aid. She will guide you in the collection effort.  Return when you have sufficient Anima and we will power the Greeter once more.
Trinkle Trinkle Little Twerp : <On the note are the scribblings for a plan to steal silkstrider larvae and cook them.  It is signed by someone named Trinkle.>

Tracker Tracking : We will require the aid of an expert tracker if we are to find the other Night Warriors.  The Wild Hunt possesses legendary skills in such matters. No quarry can elude them.  Speak with Lord Herne. With one of his hunters at your side, your search will surely be successful.
The Door to the Unknown : You empowered the final rune? Then we might yet turn the tide of battle!  Open the door, <name>! We'll hold the enemy back as long as we can!

Ember Court Ambassador : Expanding your influence is quite simple.  Find someone. Ask them what they want. Give it to them.  Congratulations. You now have influence with them.  If we wish to engage the other realms and win them over to our side, we must do the same on a larger scale.  So go to the other realms. Give them what they want. Expand our influence.

Containing the Night : It is fortunate you are here, <name>.  Thiernax believes he may know how to save Tyrande from the fate he himself suffered as the Night Warrior.  Let us hear what he has to say.

Reclaimable Anima : Mikanikos has explained much about Forsworn centurions to me, <name>.  I cannot say that I understood all of it, but it seems he has not yet found a reliable way to return them to their proper operating standards.  Their anima can still be useful, though!  Adrestes has focused on how to rededicate the temple, but not on his own safety. I worry the process will drain much of his anima.  If you can reclaim cores from the Forsworn centurions, we can use them as anima stores for Adrestes.
RSVP: Sika : Hello, <name>! Sika like to help. So much to do.  Would go to Ember Court, but too many things only Sika can do. Very sorry.

Revenge Delayed : <The Korthian protector is gravely wounded and struggles to speak.>  Devourers... swarmed the sanctuary. Too few of us...  My duty... incomplete.  The Purpose... I...  <The protector's voice fades.>

Where is Prince Renathal? : This is not victory, $p. If Prince Renathal does not return, we've merely delayed defeat.  The Prince was last seen during an assault on the Master's keep alongside Duke Theotar.  We don't know the Prince's fate, but we've learned that Duke Theotar was banished to the Ember Ward.  The Ember Ward is a land of madness and torture. Blighted by the Light, the Master sends his most hated enemies there to suffer unending agony.  Enter the Ember Ward, find Theotar, and discover the Prince's fate.

The Better Part of Valor : We now have no choice but to make a strategic retreat. Kel'Thuzad is far too fortified within the necropolis, and if Ninadar is his ally, then the House of Rituals is firmly in his grasp.  It will take nothing short of an army to save the margrave now.

How to Wear Seven Medallions : One venthyr cannot wear seven medallions and command the power they bestow, nor command respect from anyone looking at them.What I propose is the crafting of an artifact that can contain the power of the medallions. Focusing that power to one wielder.Unfortunately, Revendreth lacks the craftsmanship needed to channel such powers. Not without turning the wearer into a puppet of Denathrius.No, for this, we must employ the aid of a realm that specializes in service.Draven has the details.

A Calling in Ardenweald : Ardenweald is fractured, its roots strangled. Before we can begin to regrow our glades, we must unearth the evils that have festered here.  We call to you, today, to defend our forests. Take the weald paths through our lands, aiding our allies and defeating our enemies. With these actions, we will renew our forces, and rebuild our anima. In time, hope will blossom.  Our trust is in you, our newest seedling.

Archivist Fane : Well, our disguises are superfluous now. We will not be welcome after disrupting their depraved ritual.  Despite what we've observed here, some steadfast venthyr do still remain within these halls. Those who have not forsaken our vocation, and carry on with our calling.  Archivist Fane is one such as these. Aid his endeavors however you can. We will need his insight to loosen the Lord Chamberlain's grip over these halls.  I must tend to Gresit. He has much to learn.

A Sure Bet : You've made a name for yourself and earned the respect of everyone here, including Au'narim.  You are ready, $p!  Anzio is expecting us at the entrance to the Theater of Pain. You're going to be a champion!
Dredging up a Name : Oi, why aren't you addressing me by my proper name? Wait, I don't remember my name, proper or other. Does this mean I have amnesias? Oh no, I don't have a name, please, help!

How to Get a Head : An eager rookie who wants to be champion of the arena? People love a story like yours, but the first step is to get you noticed.   Here's the plan. Marcel Mullby needs bloodtusk skulls, but it takes a real fighter to get those!  You go kill some bloodtusks, use my knife to collect their heads, and deliver them to Mullby. That should get you recognition.

From the Mouths of Madness : I cannot express my gratitude enough for your help, champion.   We mustn't linger, however. The Jailer's forces will soon be alerted to the disturbance here.  Let us leave this place at once!

Dire Learning : Necromancers and liches often use powerful tomes to assist in their rituals. Now that the House of Rituals has expanded their reach, the tomes can be found anywhere where their members are active.  Find these books and destroy them. It won't end their vile experiments but it should at least delay them.
Flight Test : I fix these to my arms... then they become wings, yes?  Then I jump off cliff. And fly!  You watch?

Weapon in Hand : A moment, <name>.  I threw my axe Dra'gora at Helya during our first encounter in the Maw, and I haven't seen it since. If this is truly where she commands her forces, then perhaps it's held here.  I crafted that weapon in Nagrand, and it reminds me of many good days spent beside my family there. I want to feel its weight in my hands once again.

Kyrian Veteran : Bastion is healing thanks to you, <name>. The path is clear.  Your accomplishments have not gone unnoticed, even beyond the borders of Bastion.  Tales of your victories have echoed through the halls of Oribos. Zo'sorg, the Master of Conflict, has requested a meeting with you in the Enclave.  They have a keen interest in the art of war. I suggest you don't keep them waiting.

The Fearstalker : The trap has been set and the Fearstalker has walked right in.  Just as I expected, her pride has blinded her to the obvious. Have that vial I gave you earlier ready. It may prove useful in the fight ahead.  When you are ready, we can spring the trap.

Refuge of Revendreth : Sinfall is more than a ruin. It was once a place of dark magic and experimentation.  When the Light retaliated and scorched the Ember Ward, the walls of this place stood. It is fortified, supplied, and filled with secrets. A perfect staging ground for our upcoming conflict.  But first, take me to meet these allies who led you to Vorpalia. We must take stock of what resources we have to work with.

Guaranteed Delivery : <The broker appears to be from Cartel Ve. Perhaps they were once an associate of Ve'nari.  Clutched in their hand is a list of items and a containment orb.  Finishing this broker's task and sending the items back to Ve'nari will surely earn you some compensation.>

Rescued from Torment : The Mawsworn are not only killing those they find in the Seeker's Quorum. They are interrogating the survivors.  We should help save those we can. It's possible one of them might have seen the Fatescribe.

Observing the Chase : In our observations of your kind's conflict, we have noticed a high rate of escape among the prey.  This is unadvantageous to our observation efforts.  The Observer has acquired a tool we believe will improve your ability to force conflict.  Before I give it to you, we ask that you prove your willingness to participate in such conflicts, so that we know we will receive a worthy return on this investment.

Flutterback : Baine suffers within Torghast, but at least we know that he yet lives.  Rushing to his rescue would prove disastrous without a plan of attack. I will see to preparing one.  In the meantime, I suggest you bring the souls you rescued back to Ardenweald.  They deserve respite after their harrowing ordeal in the Maw, and they will surely prove vital to the Night Fae's efforts.

Dreamweaver : Troubled winds sweep across Tirna Vaal. The boughs tremble in concern over the Queen's arrival. All must be as it should be.  Dreamweaver's wings droop with the weight of worry. Chaos swirls around the wildseeds under his care.  Calm the churning waters of the grove. Bring harmony to discord and let Dreamweaver flutter once more.

Glorious Pursuits : Perhaps Draka has forgotten her loyalties, but I will fulfill my mission.  My enemy--the lich Mor'Bitan--hides within the House of Rituals. For some reason, his underlings skulk in this marsh.  We have not learned why they are here, but my devoted have spotted Mor'Bitan's second-in-command, Mephiles the Loyal. He will have our answers.  Collect him for me. Once you capture him, slay his kin. Weaken his resolve.  I will prime my base for his interrogation.

Enough Vengeance For One Day : After the Sunwell's destruction and the near extermination of my people, I vowed to claim vengeance upon Arthas and Kel'Thuzad. But I needed power to see that happen, and to seize that power I...  <Kael'thas grows quiet.>  I... am ready to return to Sinfall. I must recover my strength for what lies ahead.  As the Accuser is so fond of reminding me, I have... much to ponder.  Let us inform our allies of the enemy we have revealed.

Double Tap : The House of Rituals occupies the southern half of the temple. Unlike the constructs, their key advantage in battle is their endless army of risen fighters.  Thankfully, the Archonic Resonator we recovered will take care of it.  As we carve our way through their forces, blast their corpses with the resonator. Its energy will sunder their souls, preventing them from being raised to fight again.

Seek Your Mark : I see why Draka sent you in her stead--you accomplish what she could not.  We have all the pieces. Now, we must simply put them together.  The steps to the ritual are simple: place our fractured crystals in formation around the obelisk.  Then comes the sigil--*our* sigil. Use the maldracite powder to draw a binding glyph at the obelisk's base.  When you are through, return to me.

Winter Be Comin' : Da boss be puttin' together an army of terrible loa. Hakkar and Dambala may only be da beginnin'. How da boss get so strong? I not be seein' him use power like dis before...  Da Winter Queen not be fond of ol' Bwonsamdi, but we gonna need her help to stop Mueh'zala.  Ya be friendly wit' da Queen, no? If she be willin' to rally her forces, we might be able to stop Mueh'zala before it be too late.  Head to da Heart of da Forest and speak wit' da Queen. She be our only hope now.

An Earned Bond : There is one more thing you should do, Maw Walker.  In rebuilding the Crest of Ascension you have earned more than just the trust of your fellow kyrian. It would seem our Forgelite Prime, Mikanikos, has rather enjoyed your time together and would like to soulbind with you.  Given his predilection towards, well, himself, I am as surprised as you are. You must have truly impressed him.

Spider's Lair : When our house fell in ruins, Manipulator Zalisar seized the opportunity to reform the house under his leadership. He found few followers and soon vanished into the ruins nearby.   He has begun to manipulate the spiders and train them to be his soldiers. Spiders under his control have begun to prey upon our forces. We need to deal with this threat before it grows any worse.  I need you eliminate Manipulator Zalisar and his spider forces.

Hopeful News : The terms of our bargain have been met. You may depart with the souls you acquired.  Perhaps the fate of this "Baine" is of interest to you or your allies. I suggest you return to Oribos and consult them.  No need to rush. After all, those held within Torghast are tortured for centuries.  Kindly remember not to tell anyone about our arrangement. Discretion is key between business partners, after all.

Tracking the Shadows : The quarry has been slain, and my duties fulfilled. The tirnenn are more than capable of defending their home from the lesser devourers. Nature will take its course.  I will report back to Lord Herne and meet you at the Heart of the Forest. There we shall see what I will be hunting next.

A Defector's Request : <Unrolling the scroll, you can make out that it's a coded arms requisition from the Maldraxxi of Death's End to their venthyr allies... all servants of the Jailer.  Surely someone among the Death's Advance in Korthia will be able to help you fully break the code and learn exactly what they were planning.>

The Eye of the Jailer : <The air around you stands still. A chill of domination suffuses your being. You hear a voice.>  Yes... I remember you...  Do you think that because you evaded my grasp once, that I would let it happen again?  No. The Maw answers to me. All that befalls you here will be because I willed it so.  Death comes for you, mortal. Everywhere you go, my eye is upon you.

Wounded Memories : The arrival of Uther's wounded soul was the impetus for many events that led us to our current struggles.  Devos's broken trust. Her involvement with Helya. The rise of the Forsworn.  Bastion needs to change, but we struggle to find a solution.  Perhaps this soul fragment will provide valuable insight.

The Grand Reception : <name>, you have aided the kyrian in the most trying of times. Your devotion to our cause has helped usher in a new beginning for all of us.  We would be honored if you would join us for a gathering prior to the ceremony. Many members of our covenant wish to express their appreciation for all you have done.  This is a day of great joy. I am so pleased that you are here to witness it!

Pursuit of Justice : Draka stands ready to unleash the power of the Zerekriss upon Gharmal. We need only buy her time to focus its weapon.  What we do now, we do for all of us. Bastion and Maldraxxus have both lost many to these fiends.  He will not be defeated easily, but united our forces will finally bring him to justice!

Accusatory Missive : We have received word from Revendreth. It seems that Maldraxxi conspirators have been found skulking within their realm.  An emissary from Sinfall wishes to discuss the anima reserves we discovered.   Join me. We depart immediately.

The Cycle of Anima: Drought Conditions : In days past, keeping a forge burning was a trivial task. The anima extractors could run constantly without ever running dry.  Now, even turning an extractor on is a risk. Etherwyrms, without the anima streams to feed on, are attracted to any source of anima. They are a frequent nuisance.  I am going to ask that you risk their attentions. Activate the extractor and guard it until it can accumulate what little anima remains.  Bring me the product it collects. Let us hope it is enough.

Supplies from the Court of Harvesters : Your assistance to our cause has not gone unnoticed. More and more venthyr across the realm bind themselves to the Court of Harvesters instead of the Master.   As a result, we have collection of resources you may find useful, plundered from Sire Denathrius' most devoted followers. They are waiting for you with me in Darkhaven.

Blind Loyalty : The path forward for the kyrian is clear to me now.  First we will speak with Nikolon. I urge you to stay and listen.  Afterward, we must return to Elysian Hold.  There I will request an audience with the Archon, and I need you all by my side as I do so.

Rodent Removal : <The weapon buzzes with a dark, static energy. Whatever this Mawsworn was testing, it appears to have been somewhat successful on the nearby rodents.  Further investigation may yield additional information.>

WANTED: Aggregate of Doom : Attention all workers:   We got ourselves a problem down in the thicket.   A golem is trekking through the worksite, causing all sorts of trouble.   Grab a rock and get to throwin'. The dredger that takes it out gets the rest of the day off.   - Foreman Scug
Phantasmagoria : <The strange mote of otherworldly energy glows with an erratic rhythm.   Ve'nari may find it of interest.>

The Soul Contact : Your reputation precedes you, Maw Walker... braving the Maw and bringing Baron Mograine back in one piece...  That was most impressive!  With our dire shortage of souls, we'll need you to do that again. Bring us more willing souls so we can restore this sanctum's power!  Seek out the broker who aided you before and ask if she will do so again. You may need her.

The Forsworn Onslaught : Loyalty's betrayal shall not go unnoticed.  But while the Paragons defend the city proper, it is up to us to defend Elysian Hold.  I am very wounded... but I will hold strong. Pelagos and I will protect the survivors. You must aid in pushing back this assault!

Stay Scrappy : I can rebuild this colossus's core systems, but a few things are beyond repair. Thankfully there were enough centurions present here that I believe we can improvise.  Replacements are in order!  I require an Anima Conflux to charge its systems, some Eternity Plating to protect its core, and an Archonic Resonator to make it go boom!  I'll take care of the rest. Quickly, now!

Report to Moonberry : You have chosen well.  The Night Fae fill a critical role in the eternal cycle of nature spirits. The balance of many worlds depends on their work.  Speak with Lady Moonberry and begin your future with your covenant.
Tubbins's Tea : Theotar teach Tubbins special tea that make Light go away!  Tubbins good tea maker!  Watch Tubbins make Theotar feel good!  Then Tubbins feel good!

Acquisition: Blazing Ingots : <The runesmiths have imbued this ingot with an enchantment that causes it to burn with inextinguishable flames.   It is likely that this metal is used to empower the Mawsworn protectors of Zovaal's Cauldron.   Bringing some samples of this ore to Ve'nari could aid her attempts at unlocking the Jailer's secrets.>

The Hills Have Eyes : The other houses have yet to launch a full scale assault, but do not mistake their cowardice for incompetence.  Any tactician worth their weight in maldracite knows the value of espionage. I suspect that the agents of our foes skulk within our own ranks as we speak.  Take one of my hounds. It will know our enemies by their scent. Once the pests have been discovered, exterminate them.

Strengthening the Bond : I know how you feel... and what you have endured for the sake of your world.   You now know of my own triumphs and tragedies as well.  Our bond will grow stronger over time. But for now, let us see what it has granted us.  Ardenweald has needs of us. We must do everything in our power to save it.
Building the Base : The Crest is almost complete.  I give you the honor of the final touch.  You have done much. Please, take Phaestus and give the final blow!

The Key to Rebuilding : If we plan to revive the estate, we'll first need the keys!  When Theotar was exiled to the Ember Ward, he lost all titles and property, meaning that the estate fell into the hands of another aristocrat.   The new owner is a mystery to me, but household staff almost always carry keys on them as they do their business within the Old Gate.   Recover the key and we'll be on our way to rebuilding the manor.

Land of Opportunity : <The grandmaster's voice rings out over the roaring crowd.>  This is it! The final event of the tournament!  These two Maldraxxi gladiators have cut down challenger after challenger. Now the only thing left...  Is for one to slay the other!

The Work of One's Hands : Too long have my hands been idle!  <Forgelite Sophone smiles warmly at you.>  You cannot know what this means to me, but I might be able to show you. For your aid in restoring my forge, please allow me to craft you a piece of armor.  It will not be an extravagant affair, but through good works we grow to know ourselves better.  I will need your aid once more. Sika and I will guide you on the specifics. All you need to do is listen and do as instructed.  What do you say?

No Crate Unturned : That explosion will likely bring onlookers from the House of Rituals. We must act quickly.  Search through the debris for anything that looks out of the ordinary. It is likely that Kel'Thuzad's mystery reagent won't be hard to spot.

Visions of the Dreamer: The Betrayal : I sense that in the spirit's vision, she struggles with the memory of a betrayal that is truly profound.   Someone as close to her as a brother, turned to an enemy.  Go to the second Dreamshrine in the Basin, and help vanquish the pain of this nightmare.

Directing Dedication : The five temples of Bastion have stood strong since its very creation. The idea of rededicating one has never been broached before, and will no doubt require a significant amount of anima.  Underneath this temple are stores of anima we rationed for the drought. Now that anima is returning, we can use these reserves for our purposes.  You will need to use channelers and collectors throughout the grounds to redirect anima to the top. That should give me the power I need.

Manifesting Power : As you know, shedding our memories of life can result in dangerous creatures known as manifestations. They have increased in number and strength as of late, but I believe we can find use for them yet.  Manifestations carry great power within them--power we may purify and use in our own creations at the forge here. In making something positive out of such negativity, we do a noble act of service.  Simply eliminate any you come across, and collect their essence. That is all.

Re-Introductions : Though you have chosen your path, the fate of the Shadowlands has yet to be determined.  The power of the Banished One grows. It falls to you, and others of your kind, to thwart him.  The Arbiter's Honored Voice, Tal-Inara, will aid you in choosing a covenant. Bolstering their strength offers our best chance at victory.  Let the Purpose guide you, <name>. Always.

My Way or the Hyphae : <An old, booming voice fills your mind.>  Hmph. More are coming.  I would rather not lose more of myself, and I don't want you to think I'm not appreciative of the work you and Cort here have done.  How about you take a ride on the rings and give those oafs a good thrashing? We'll teach them not to mess with Marasmius and his fae rings!

Their Last Line of Defense : Those sneaky Drust are protecting Gorak Zhar with their evil magic!  I can sense several foul runes that are scattered across Darkreach. If you destroy them, we can easily shatter the barrier around that nasty Gorak Zhar.  Hurry! I will meet you inside the enemy camp.

The Curator : I tasked the Curator with reacquiring the Medallion of Avarice.  However, since her return from the Maw, her mind has become... a bit chaotic. Do be kind, will you?    I ask that you lend her assistance in her search. She is at the Crypt of the Forgotten.

Missing Stone Fiend : You or I could wield these sinstones directly, but I much prefer to use stone fiends for such tasks.  Exceptional results, no personal risk.  Unfortunately, my stone fiend did not return from its last errand.  Speak with Cryptkeeper Kassir in the archives above. He is loyal to the Accuser and will loan us his stone fiend.

RSVP: Grandmaster Vole : I'm busy, so I'll get right to the point.   The only way I'm going is if you pay me enough coin to make it worth my while or you amuse me.   As interesting and enjoyable as the Ember Court may be, I lose money every time I am away from here. That said, I do love a good slaughter.  So, coin or deaths. Take your pick.

Queen of the Underground : You tracked the massive gorm here to her den, and we've found Master Sha'lor.  Perhaps not entirely unscathed, but he lives. That is enough.  One last task remains. Let us end this.

Ritual of Purification : I have finished making preparations for the ritual. The moment of truth has come.  The Drust fetish that Ulfar gave you will channel the ritual's power into Gweyir. It should counteract the curse that imprisons her mind.   This will not be pleasant. It may not even work. But this is the only chance we have to free her.

Trouble on the Western Front : Alexandros and our Maldraxxi allies need reinforcement at the western gate on the Margrave's opposite flank. They are barely holding on!  Our forces will reinforce our position here and push forward towards Gharmal. We must make haste to Mograine--without both flanks we cannot hope to achieve victory.

The Endless Forest : Well, that's all I have for you! Whew! You've been on a whirlwind tour of things around here, haven't you? Up and down and slantways and even into the Maw! Your head must be practically spinning.  <Flutterby giggles.>  You should check in with Lady Moonberry and let her know your training is complete!  She probably won't quiz you on what you've learned.  Probably.

Stolen Korthian Supplies : <These supplies are marked with the seal of the Death's Advance, stolen from the Rift without being noticed.  Duchess Mynx in Keeper's Respite would be very grateful to have this returned.>

Sanctum Improvements : Your will to succeed is strong, Maw Walker. With the anima and the souls you have recovered, we can now begin to unlock our sanctum's true potential.  As we acquire more souls and more anima, we can gain even greater power from the Seat of the Primus. Remain relentless in your pursuit, and victory will be ours.

Claim the Sky : I mourn the loss of my sisters and desire nothing more than to avenge them. Yet I know that I am no match for the witch's magics or her army of Mawsworn.  We must let wisdom guide us and fly from here.   Though I am weak from my captivity, I have the strength to bear you from this place.  Let us go, friend.
Moving Mirrors : What sort of horrific trap is this? The Light is being reflected directly on her!   Simone's a dear friend of mine! Free her from that thing, please!
Rat Soul : <The Rat Soul is curious and sociable. The shape of the rat will be yours to call upon.>

Kindred Spirits : I have come to the realization that you and I are meant to be the most kindred of spirits.   Your enduring nature has enraptured me, and I'm afraid I cannot bear to imagine an afterlife without your beguiling presence.   Let us bind our souls, and forever carry each other in both heart and mind.

Strengthen the Bond : To bond souls is but the first step. You must now explore its potential.  Just as Pelagos will gain strength from you, so too shall you grow from him. As your bond grows over time you will touch deeper into one another's souls, and so your strength shall increase.   All you must do is place your hand upon the Forge of Bonds to augment your bond. There is no price to pay--the only limitation is your connection to our sacred covenant.

Grathalax, the Extractor : There are many powerful lieutenants among the Mawsworn, but there is one who is particularly important to the Jailer.  Far beneath the Tremaculum lives the Jailer's prime interrogator, Grathalax. Power is fed to him via conduits throughout the area.  His role is to make the process of anima extraction more efficient. His methods are... unkind.  I believe we would both benefit from the end of his existence.

Ascension Calling: Mikanikos : <While this scroll mimics Kleia's invitation to the Path of Ascension, it is very clearly written in Sika's hand.  It details an invitation for Mikanikos to participate in the Path, along with Bron.  Perhaps you should bring this to Mikanikos.>

Understanding the Shadowlands : As I sat upon the Frozen Throne all those years, <name>, I could peer into the Shadowlands. Brief glimpses, clouded and uncertain. Sights both wondrous and terrible.  We must work together to make sense of what has happened. To prevent the Maw from consuming all of reality.  Whatever Sylvanas and the Jailer want, we must stop them. But we cannot do so alone.  Perhaps Tal-Inara can put us on the path to find answers.

Anima Instincts : Voras is clearly content to roam the Elder Stand. We will need a way to lure it to us once we are ready to fight.  Did you notice the wildseeds in the clearing where we spotted it? Voras must be feasting on the concentrated anima contained within them.  There should still be some expended wildseeds from before the drought in the Gormhive. Let us create bait too tempting for Voras to ignore.

The Afflictor's Key : Sylvanas thinks us broken. She believes she has already won.  We will show her how mistaken she is.  First, I will need your help. The bonds that hold me are impossibly strong. We will need the key to free me of them.  My... imprisonment here has been overseen by a creature they call the Afflictor. The key is likely in its possession.

Runestone Roundup : Stone is a rare material in Ardenweald. Yet, I've heard tales that those who were masked by the Drust have small stones upon them.  I'd like you to retrieve some of these stones for the Wild Hunt, so that we may better understand their link to our enemy. Face the masked and collect the stones from their deceased forms and I'll compensate you for your efforts.  It's a gruesome task, but one that must be done.
